review_body: Located within five minutes walk of the railway station and renowned 'Scramble Crossing'.A compact hotel to say the least but you won't be staying there to look at it lol as Tokyo is a whopper of a city! We just refreshed and ventured out.Must give a mention to the bidet toilets which are common in Japan!

The location of the hotel is superb! 5 mins to shibuya crossing and shopping mall / alley. Most importantly, nearby to all Halal restaurant / stall in shibuya! The rooms and the toilet is rather small compare to the price that you pay.. But its in the center of shibuya!! So no complaint! The essential toiletries they provided is excellent. The room were clean everyday n the bed is comfortable.

I stayed here for 5 nights. From outside it looks like nothing special. We go down the escalator we see the reception table but the girl led me to a machine on the side to check-in. I got a room with 2 single beds. No way was a double bed going to fit me and my 6’1 boyfriend which they said fits 2 people so spent a little extra to get 2 beds. Amenities like toothbrush, brush, Q-tips, little extras always go a long way for me. The water pressure of the shower was strong. I love the heated toilet seat and it had a bidet too. They give you night robes as well. The AC was not strong so it felt hot in the room. Good thing I bring my small travel fan.We were on the 11th floor, did not hear street noise but the train outside but it was ok soothing almost. The beds were not too comfortable so it wasn’t good for my bad back. The TV did not give you local TV stations, it only had movies which you had to buy movies. WiFi was almost nonexistent. But overall for a hotel in Shibuya it was pretty good. So many restaurants close to the hotel. Location was the amazing for a first time visitor to Tokyo. The entrance to the Shibuya Station was steps away from the hotel. Stayed for 5 nights and it was very pleasant. 4 stars!

Great location, proximity to the Shibuya scramble and great eateries. Room was small but comfortable and had a hot pot for coffee and tea. Small bathroom but had amenities, i.e. bidet with temperature control. No closet but a space to hang your clothes. Breakfast had western and Japanese selection which was great. The only downside was we had an early flight so we were not able to avail of the breakfast. I tried to compromise if we could have some snacks before leaving for the airport since it was paid for, and they just said No. The other downside was since front desk was not street level, the escalator is not in operation before 6 a.m. It is a plight of stairs to carry your luggage up. They have to consider that mostly are tourists who have heavy luggages. It is unusual that a hotel would have to stop operations of its facilities that are constantly being used by guest. Otherwise a clean hotel.

As expected, the room is tiny, but the bed is comfortable and the room is equipped with all basic amenities.The hotel is conveniently located close to Shibuya station though.Walls between rooms are quite thin, so do keep your noise down and sometimes you may hear people next door.

Caught the subway from Tokyo Bay to Shibuya. Very easy to find as was on the same side of the road as BIc Camera and McDonald’s. Checking in we got a trainee receptionist who had a senior male colleague lurking ominously behind her, no smile no eye contact, no acknowledgement of guest (us) (he was scary might even the hotel ghost ), I wanted to confirm our check out 18/7/19 and check in on the 19/7/19 was in order ( I only know greetings and thank you in Japanese) which seemed to confuse her , the senior made no move to help her , I did not persist), in another situation with the same unfortunate trainee, her trainer stepped in straight away to help (I asked if our bags could be held at the hotel).Room was small but good considering price and location, bathroom tiny, cleanliness was ho-hum. Walls were thin. Shampoo and conditioner were really good. Next trip would consider accomodation further out as subway is user friendly for newbies to Japan. Shibuya crossing 5mins away. Family Mart on one side of hotel and McDonald’s on the other. French bakery across the rd. Subway about a min away as well. Needed cash to top up suica cards, could not find an atm to withdraw cash at the station ☹️.

We had good experience with this hotel. It was nice and clean with decent sized toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, body wash) you can actually use (which seems to be part of the norm in Japan, but I still thought it was worth mentioning).There are close to no storage space for your clothes except for a small coat rack by the door. The breakfast buffet was great! It is subjective to taste, but they had some good Japanese selection. I didn't pay close attention to their western fare, because I am in Japan, why would I?They had a cute onigiri station that interchanges with the omellette station. I did enjoy that immensely.Everybody is saying it's a close walk from the Shibuya Station, which it is... but do note that if you are carrying luggage from Narita Express, it is more than 5 minutes because the platform for Narita is farther. I am not saying not to walk to the hotel, just don't think it would be easy (especially if you are caught with that rush hour crowd, oh boy).

Only a 5 minute walk from Shibuya station. Take the Hatchiko crossing exit and turn right going underneath the railway bridge, then at the first traffic lights, cross the road to your left, then the hotel is about one minute away. Perhaps follow google map directions for the first time then after that it is really easy.The hotel is close to everything such as restaurants, Family Mart (which is like a 7/11) and various shops. 2 min walk to Hatchiko crossing. Breakfast buffet is great with a wide range of western and Japanese food. I really liked that they had a juicer that served fresh pineapple and carrot juice.All receptionists and house keepers were professional and polite.Our room was a medium sized room which we were happy with. Rooms in Japan are typically small, but this was bigger than a small room.Overall, we stayed for four nights and the hotel provided great value. We would happily return.

Nice hotel, highlight: great location, just a couple of blocks from Shibuya crossing and metro station. Good japanese and western breakfast. Excellent service. Dowside: small rooms but is normal in Japan.

What I really like about this hotel is the stone-throw distance to Shibuya Station. Well connected through the subway, you can easily reach other parts of Tokyo easily! We left our luggage with the counter on the last day after check out and collected them in the evening where we roll our luggage for about 10mins before reaching Shibuya Mark City building- take the lift up to level 5 (level4 then take escalator up) for Airport Bus to both Narita or Haneda! So thats really convenient for us. You ask can the hotel counter about the bus timings and price (pay to bus driver).Hotel room wise is standard, small but as per Japanese major city standard.

Adequate sized room with a comfy double bed in an ideal location a few minutes from the Hachiko exit of Shibuya next to Bic Camera. The hotel is your typical business hotel with just enough basics to be comfortable while you spend the rest of the day shopping and eating out. Convenient and a fair price for Tokyo accommodations.

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for the last part of our Japan trip. Our two-person room was clean but had a strange "musty" smell. Thankfully, the hotel provided an air cleaner in the room so we had it running 24/7. The bed was HUGE by Japan standards; was almost a king size. But the rest of the room was compact and there wasn't much space for our luggage. Shower had good water pressure. The staff was polite and professional. Besides free wifi, not much else in terms of amenities.The location is the selling point of this hotel. If you want your home base to be in Shibuya, then you can't go wrong staying here. Shibuya Station is literally a 5 minute walk away. Tons of restaurants and shops all within a 10-15 minute walk away. Besides the musty smelling room, there is not much to complain about. If I were to stay in Shibuya again, however, I would try to find another hotel with better value.

I spent 4 nights in this hotel with toddler. The hotel just 5 minutes walk to shibuya crossing and also next to BIC camera. Convenion store also near from the hotel. The room not so big but its clean and everything great except there’s no elevator from lobby to reception.

We stayed 3 nights. Easy to explore anywhere in Tokyo from this hotel as the station (exit 10) is just outside the front door. Took us 29 minutes to travel from Shibuya to Haneda airport (only 480 yen ea) when we departed. Hotel is just around the corner from cross walk, next door to BIC Camera, across from Tokyo Department Store and many other interesting areas. Across the road is some amazing and reasonably priced food. The patisserie across the road on the corner is worth a stop. So much to see and taste!. We upgraded a twin room to get some extra space. The room has a large range of amenities (well above three star). Bathroom is compact however water pressure and shower quality is great. Hotel was quiet despite busy location. Will use this hotel again when visiting Tokyo. So convenient!

A lovely hotel with a delicious breakfast and walking distance to Shibuya Station. The rooms in Tokyo are smaller than Australian rooms but has everything you need and a good size for a couple. The staff are so helpful - A great hotel ☺️

Checked in on this hotel for our annual family travel. Very nice location as it is just a few meters away to the Shibuya train station. There is also a Family Mart and restos nearby where you can grab some eats. Service is excellent. Hotel staff are very accomodating. Will definitely stay in this hotel again.

review_body: The hotel is located around the corner of downtown Shibuya, where everything was just 5 minutes walk away. Is it also right outside of the subway exit and 3 minutes from JR station. The hotel reception is at the basement level where you have to take the escalator down to get to the lift to your room, its a little complicated if you carry a big suitcase with you, other than that, the hotel is a good choice.

Having left the booking of accomodation for a Jan 2019 trip until the last moment, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality pf the hotel.The location is perfect, minutes from the Shibuya Crossing, and very close to the Train Station. The room was very cozy, not much more than a bed, with a long shelf under the window, housing the tv and phone - we needed to put the suitcase on the bed to open it!The bathroom was small, but very clean and plenty of toiletries provided. Be sure to put the shower curtain inside the shower/bath or you will quickly flood the space.Handy coin operated washing and drying facilities are available at the hotel, which is good for longer stays.All things considered, a great hotel and would stay again if in Shibuya.

Spending a week in Tokyo and was originally planning to stay in Shinjuku, but at the last minute changed to Shibuya. And in retrospect, was the best decision.The Hotel lived up to its marketing and reviews I read. It was easy to reach from Narita Airport and easy to locate after leaving the station. Follow the directions on their website - perfect directions.The reception staff were friendly, quick and efficient. Check in was a breeze. The rooms were small, but comfortable. A little creativity and it worked.Breakfast was unbelievable - a complete spread, with a Tuna Station, but my favorite and Omelette Station. There was nothing short at breakfast.I wish we stayed at least 2-more days, because of its location. Shibuya Scramble is meters away, Mega Donki, Dept Stores. Just wonderful.Thank You Tokyu Rei. You made our vacation awesome.

If you’re okay with small rooms, there is no beating Tokyu REI. The location is superbly convenient if you want to visit the Shibuya disctrict. Just 3 minutes from the Shibuya crossing. BIC Camera is just next door and they basically have everything. McDonalds is also next door, so it’s convenient to eat at night. The only downside is the size of the room and bathrooms. If you’re a bit “big”, this hotel may not be a good suit for you as it is really limiting.

The staff here are REALLY FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL. Location is 5 min from Shibuya Crossing! Clean and great room. Not a huge room but typical of whta you would get in the heart of Tokyo. They give you slippers too! There is a restaurant there but we didnt eat there so cannot comment. Only minor thing is there is only an escaltor going doownstairs to the front desk - no elevator. No big deal for me personally as they will also help you with luggage.

Stayed here for two nights as part of a package around Japan. Room was quite small but wasn’t a problem for us, room had everything needed and was very comfortable. The staff at the front desk were lovely and the breakfast was very nice also. It is also central to most stuff in Shibuya. Thank you for getting our trip in Japan off to a great start!

Stayed 2 nights on level 7 and found the room very clean, compact but comfortable. Was small but was typical size for Tokyo. Bathroom is very compact and bit dated but nice toiletries supplied. Room also has a kettle and mini fridge. Staff was friendly and helpful and offered to store our bags after check out. Location was excellent being:- 2 mins walk from shibuya station and crossing as well as hedgehog cafe (about 4mins away!)- surrounded by eateries and not far from shops and department stores. Would recommend staying here again.

If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Shibuya, this is the place. It is located around the corner from Shibuya Crossing.The reception is manned 24/7, ideal for those who are arriving late in the night as we did. The staff were incredibly hospitable, friendly and polite. Those who didn’t speak English quite well, would always politely pass you onto someone who did. The food at the restaurant was nice, but slightly overpriced - very westernised. But the morning buffet has a live and fresh tuna preparation which was interesting.The staff clean the room every day - making the beds and folding the robes. They will change your sheets each day too, if you wish.The only complaint I would have, is the wireless was quite slow - to the point where we couldn’t really access much. Worth the investment to get a wireless router and take it with you around Japan. (Japan Wireless is a good company).

location is so convenient! It's less than 5 mins wall to Shibuya crossing. There's convenient stores / McDonald's right beside the hotel. If you need portable WiFi, you can head across the streets to rent!As usual, rooms in Japan are small. But the bed is huge, sufficient for one person and one luggage. Toilet is small too. So do not expect a lot. I would pay this amount for the location as it is close to everything including the train stations!

1. Location: Good. Easy reach to Shibuya station once you orientate yourself. Being in Shibuya, there is not shortage of food or shops.2. Staff: Functional, efficient and communicates very well in English.3. Room: Comparable to typical Japanese standards. Comfortable, good wifi.

The hotel is just outside of exit no. 10 of Shibuya station. they serve a tasty breakfast. the room was comfortable and the staff was kind and helpful. I stayed at this hotel for three night and enjoyed it.

My family and I stayed in the hotel for a couple of days during our Tokyo leg of the Japan trip, and found it value-for-money and convenient! Location-wise, there's a subway exit right outside the hotel from Shibuya Station (but of course, Shibuya Station has many exits). It's right next to BIC Camera, and is just a quick walk away from all the amazing Shibuya shopping and also the famous crossing. This makes it a very convenient base. We stayed in the twin rooms. There are two types of twin rooms, one of which had a bed slightly bigger than a usual single bed, but smaller than a double, which works great if you have a young child travelling but sharing a bed. Room was clean with the usual room amenities and do note rooms in Tokyo are typically small (that's the norm). Cable TV does require the additional payment, so it's just local channels otherwise. Breakfast was buffet-style, and had a good range of Japanese and Western options. Would consider the hotel again in my next visit!

Hotel was a little hard to find from the shibuya station. But once you see the sign, it is very near from all the shops and station. Staffs were very friendly. Room was clean. Check in and check out was fast. Room and bathroom was small as expected (large luggage will not open completely as there is no space). Will definitly recommend this.

Hotel Rei is right in the center of Shibuya crossing as mentioned by alot of visitors . Easy to locate is to look for BIC camera . The room is small, clean n compact . With 2 adults n 1 kid (3 luggage’s), very squeezing. Take note . I booked for twin room. Got one of the bed is like “queen size” and the other one is Super single. This is good for family of 3.

Will choose Rei Hotel when I come again to Tokyo. Room was clean and had all the amenities I required. The size of the room was also bigger compared to other hotels around the same price. The main thing that was great about the Hotel was the location which was right in the heart of Shibuya.

I was travelling in Tokyo for business and I was very satisfied with my experience at this hotel. The check in process was efficient, and the hotel was easy to find, even from the Narita Express platforms at Shibuya station. Many other hotels comment on the rooms being small which is true however travelling solo I had no problems with space. The air conditioning in my room also worked perfectly when I used it in the summer months.The only criticism I would give was that the bathroom was a little crampt and a little old, however it was still better than many other hotels. Also the restaurant buffet for breakfast may seem a little strange for western tastes.

stayed here for 8 nights. the location is perfect, close to Shibuya station. just need to follow Miyamasuzaka East exit when exiting shibuya station which takes you to the intersection of Bic Camera to get to hotel. if it’s raining, at the intersection there is a subway entrance, if you go down and follow exit 10, it will take you across the street and come up to hotel entrance. there is a family mart close by to buy snacks and a mcdonald’s. Check in was fast, they also had my Mifi at the front desk which i made arrangements to be delivered upon arrival. we had a room on 12th floor, double standard. typical size room for Japan, there was a desk big enough to plug in laptop and phones, refrigerator, hotpot, tea and coffee, 2 bottles of water daily. a lot of space for our luggage, we had 2 big suit cases and 2 small suit cases. 2 of them could fit under seating area next to the desk, one on suit case rack and the other in closet area. there are no drawers to put your clothes in, but i either hung them up or put them on shelf in closet. bathroom is small, but enjoyed soaking in the tub because it was deep. our stay included a breakfast buffet from 6:30 - 10 am. we ate there everyday since nothing really opens till 10 or 11 am unless you want to walk around shibuya to eat ramen or curry. the buffet is the same, every other day they have a omelet or musubi station. i suggest getting the breakfast because the food was pretty good, western and japanese style food available. plus from previous experience coming to japan, i hated having to look for some place to eat since i wake up early.the day before checking out, i asked the front desk if they could make arrangements for a taxi to pick us up at 7:30 pm to take us to Haneda airport and advised him we had 5 suit cases. He said he will try his best to get a big taxi. it was raining when we were checking out, i’m glad we asked ahead of time to take a taxi rather than dragging our luggage to bus station next to Excel Hotel. i was impressed when taxi arrived, they helped us take our luggage up the escalator, and walked us to taxi with umbrella to load it up! it cost us about $75 but it’s worth it rather than dragging suitcases through the busy streets of shibuya in the rain! overall, i would definitely stay here again. it’s close to the station but away from the busy streets of people walking about. the staff are very courteous. the room was clean and quiet, unless some one was making noise in the hallway. oh, there is a laundry room, ice machine, and vending machine on the 5th floor. on the first floor lobby, they have a smoking area too.thanks Shibuya Tokyu Rei, i enjoyed my stay at your hotel and excellent service.

This little hotel had 9 floors of accommodation in a convenient location just 10 minutes walk from Shibuya station and the famous Shibuya Crossing. The hotel front desk is down an escalator or stairs from the street then up in either of 2 lifts to rooms.

2nd time staying here as the location is very good. Room was spacious enough for us and bed was comfy. Bic Camera is next door which is ideal as you can go and enjoy the massage chairs before heading back to your hotel =P hehe

This hotel is very close to Shibuya Station, a few minutes away from Shibuya Crossing. The hotel’s main lobby is at the lower basement. There is a restaurant near the lobby. My room is perfect for a solo traveler (With safe, ref and air purifier). The bathroom had a (deep) bath tub. Toiletries were available.

Really great location. 2 minutes from Shibuya station.The room really small. The breakfast is greatThe air conditioning/ ac was not functioning well. I’m traveling during the summer.. my son really need the AC. It was HOT.

The location of this hotel is good, around the corner from the subway and the Shibuya crossing and lots of restaurants to eat in, what lets this hotel down is the staff, they are a little rude and don't speak very good english. The rooms are very small but you have to expect that in Tokyo so we didnt worry to much as we only slept there as out all day. Our room was clean and comfortable and we were on the floor with the laundry room and the drink vending machine which was handy. I would stay here again just for the location. Breakfast was average.

We immediately felt uncomfortable as soon as we entered the room. My boyfriend and I noticed brown stains along the walls, dust all over the air purifier and long strands of hair in the bathroom! That night we also noticed two brown/redish stains on the comforter. The next night we noticed that it had not been changed or cleaned, as the stains were still there. After requesting for a new blanket, they gave us a new one that had MULTIPLE log strands of hair in it! I always noticed a strong, smelly stench coming from the toilet. Also the bathroom had a hole in the wall that was covered with duct tape. *Long story short DO NOT stay at this hotel. We were extremely uncomfortable the entire time, we even tried to cancel our reservation. I will admit that the location of this hotel is pretty good, but it is filthy and not worth it.

This hotel was the first that we stayed in on our trip. It was in an excellent location - close to the station and many bars, shops and restaurants in walking distance. Room was a bit small but we really only slept and showered there. It was very clean and smart. Staff were very helpful. Toilet was amazing - used all the buttons!

This place is in a perfect location for Tokyo first timers or those who want to be central. Good staff and rooms are a bit larger than what you'd get in a business hotel. The rooms were clean but not spotless. I saw the cleaners working fast so I'm guessing that's more of an upper management issue. The rooms need a deep clean (dusty sprinklers etc) and current Japanese corporate cost cutting doesn't allow for this. It's also evident in the too warm, slightly stuffy rooms. I set the temperature at the minimum allowed (20c) but it felt more like 24c. When you're paying in excess of U.S.D 100 you should get to choose how cold you want to be.They might as well get rid of all those useless "air ionisers" or whatever that were a big craze in Japan a few years ago but now just gather dust and take up space. All in all a good place to stay though.

stayed here for 10 days as a solo traveler, the staff are lovely and the hotel as a hole is great. But some things such as the room cleaning could be done quicker. came back at 3 and had to wait for a while for the room to be done. Also the restaurant is lovely for breakfast but for lunch or dinner not so much. Got turned away multiple times for lunch not once did they say let me book you a table they just kept saying no. And with dinner very hard to get service as a Foreigner, even harder to alert staff to my problem of undercooked chicken.

We stayed 3 nights at Shibuya Tokyu Rei Hotel. The location is really good : right in the middle of everything. The metro exit 10 is in front of the hotel. There is a family mart near the building.Our room is tiny, but this is Tokyo so I don't mind.The room is clean and have good amenities. Staff were helpful and friendly. We really love our stay here.

The Good: Location is excellent - a train station entrance is right in front of the hotel (Exit 10). The staff went above and beyond to ensure everything is perfect. The room even though so small but very clean and tidy. The WiFi was strong too! The Bad: The room was understandably small - it’s Tokyo after all. But the bed was way TOO soft. My back hurt after a night of sleeping. Also the room’s air-conditioner wasn’t working well when outside was very warm. I needed to ask for a small floor-fan to help cool the room down so we were able to sleep. Tip: The check out time is 10 AM but if you apply for the hotel membership, you can extend the check out time to 12.00 And the breakfast buffet isn’t worth it - don’t bother.

Pathetically small rooms. We had a family twin room which had a double bed and a single bed. Only the beds can accommodate 3 adults and 1 toddler, leaving practically no space for anything else. We can't even have any luggage left open. So we had to take turns to open our luggage, take what we needed and close it back. The bathroom is the worst part. It's the size of a cruise ship cabin bathroom! There's hardly any space and I seriously don't understand why there's still a bathtub in there. The tub is so small no average size human can lie comfortably for a bath, not to mention a bigger size one like myself. Not that I would take a long bath anyway, it didn't look that clean.The location isn't that wonderful afterall. It's a short walk to Shibuya crossing and all other action but not as convenient getting to and fro the airport. It is near to the metro exit but that exit is served by stairs only.Overall, extremely underwhelming for the kind of price we paid. Never ever going to stay here again.

Excellent location right in the middle of everything Rooms are tiny but to be expected I guessThey were clean, and the breakfast selections were amazing. Staff were helpful and friendly and we loved every minute of the stay

I stayed four nights at Tokyo REI hotel in Shibuya. The location is absolutely the best. One minute to Shibuya station and 5-10 minutes to any attraction or shopping areas. The hotel is very basic. The room is comfortable but relatively outdated. Very small bathroom and not enough light. The cleaning of the room was average. I enjoyed staying in this hotel because the location only.

stayed there for 4days. the room,though small was clean including the bathroom,pillows were soft & comfy,towelswere clean & smelled fresh always, wifi wasreally fast, the front desk were so courteous & accomodating & would go the extra mile to teach you how to go tocertain tourist spots, very accessible because it was very near the metro railstation, very near the shopping area & totop it all, their japanese breakfast was really yummy.would definitely go back & recommend this hotel to my family & friends

I stayed here three nights on a business trip. The room was small but clean and had everything one needs. Service was efficient and friendly, and the location was excellent, just a few minutes walk to everything. Extras are pay as you go, including pay TV and the minibar, so check-out is very simple. If you are not looking for something fancy, this is a good option for central Tokyo.

The hotel is located near the Shibuya-crossing in central Shibuya - we couldn't have wished for a better location. Also, it is located near Shibuya Station and a lot of nice shopping and sightseeing-locations.

We only spent one night here, our last night in Tokyo after returning from the ski fields. However the location was perfect for us to head back to Harajuku and Cat Street to pick up some items we spotted on our earlier visit, before returning home again. It was also only a two-minute walk from a Tengu Izakaya, a great place to eat. The TOHO cinema is also very close by, on the other side of the Shibuya Crossing. Unfortunately we couldn't make it to the hotel breakfast in the morning, as our flight departure times meant we had to catch a very early Narita Express train. The hotel is located very close to Shibuya station, so we were able to get onto this train reasonably easily in the morning. On a side note, exercise caution with this, my big and strong partner was able to take the luggage for both of us, and the station was not completely busy yet - but if I were travelling alone (I am not that strong!) I think I would prefer to send my luggage ahead of me to the airport (Takkyubin!) to avoid having to drag heavy suitcases up staircases and escalators, through a crowded Shibuya station. PS The room is still tight by western standards, but the big and strong partner found this room a little more comfortable than other Tokyo rooms we have stayed in.

Our stay in the hotel was wonderful. Great location...very close to shopping malls, restos, and train stations. Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. The two (2) rooms given to us were small though...typical of most hotel rooms in Tokyo area.

Great location 2 minutes away from the large pedestrian crossing in Shibuya. Rooms are pretty small, but it’s manageable. If you are looking for a place to stay with a great location, this is it. A good bargain overall.

pls do something about your airconditioning system asap. i have asthma that's why i'm hesitant staying in your hotel. I'm expecting for the rooms to be clean dust free and organize. i'm trying to reach out tru your hotel customer service but failed to align. thank you

A nice hotel close to subway and shibuya crossing. Close to shopping and everything. Hotel is clean. Friendly staff. Very small but clean rooms. But i will surely stay there again because of the location.

The highlight of this hotel was the fantastic location, subway exit about 20m away, family mart just down the road and very close the shibuya main station. Breakfast was excellent. The only negatives were no elevator to get to the lobby which was tricky with a pushchair and lots of suitcases, no air conditioning in the room only heater so our room was very hot and wifi was slow in our room but fast in my parents room next door. Really appreciated the wonderful service, thank you to all the staff who were so friendly and helpful.

It was the first time I went to Tokyo, and I booked this hotel. Like any other hotels in Japan, the rooms were quite small. However, I didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel, just to take a sleep, so it was not a big deal. The room was clean which is the most important factor to me, and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast was quite tasty, but not as diverse as I had expected. Also, there are many drugstores, shops nearby, it is convenient to go anywhere from here. So, in general, it was good experience.

My 2nd time in tokyo rei hotel. I will always choose tokyo rei hotel in tokyo!!! Easy access in everything, small room yes but its clean and neat. Unfortunately they can’t adjust the temperature of their heater its too hot and when you open the window it’s noisy you can hear the noise outside and they still have a slow wifi connection :( but still i so love shibuya tokyo rei . Thank you for having us to celebrate holidays ❤️

This is a great hotel if you are a tourist in Tokyo. It is in the center of everything and with the great metro system, all destinations are just a hop away. The rooms are small, as to be expected in Tokyo, but they are clean and comfortable. We got some of the best sleep on our trip at this hotel. The only negative in my opinion was breakfast. They had some western options, like scrambled eggs, however they were basically liquid and not cooked well.

What an amazing small hotel which is across the street from the Shibya Station. It is right next to BIC Camera, a store which sells everything. We were welcome to this hotel by their wonderful staff. The rooms were small but we expected that. Rooms and bathroom were very clean with crisp white linen. We had the most delicious breakfast buffet each morning. There were western selections as well as Japanese selections. When you walk in you are welcomed by a fresh squeezed seasonal fruit juice.The restaurant also offers seasonal delicacies that was so delicious. At check out we were helped by one of the most cheerful front desk attendants. Thank you for the wonderful hospitality which made our stay in Tokyo so memorable. I highly recommend this hotel.

I stayed in a twin room for one night and there is no getting away from the fact that it's small. The walkways are just wide enough for one person to pass through and a place to put large luggage isn't obvious. Walls are a tad thin too.That said, if you arrive with just the clothes on your back, it has all the toiletries you'd need, a nightshirt and phone chargers for both beds. Sleep was very comfortable, so while it isn't a room you'd spend a lot of time in by choice, it's very nice place to return to at the end of a long day.Service staff were helpful and breakfast choices were a good mix of local and Western. Check-out is early at 10 am but if you sign up as a member for free, you can request to stay until noon.

We spent one night at Shibuya Tokyu REI Hotel while in transit to the Five Lakes District and loved how central we were. Trains and buses depart within a few minutes walk and it was amazing to be this close to the infamous Shibuya Crossing.Front desk were courteous and helpful, offering to stow our bags when we arrived too early for check-in. We stayed in a twin room, which was small (but not cramped) and provided all the amenities we needed for our short stay. Our room looked out over the train lines, tall buildings, and a few streets and alleys so it was a wonderful cross-section of Tokyo's inner city.They have an onsite restaurant, which is great if you don't fancy heading out for dinner. And the breakfast spread is excellent - juice, fresh fruit, breads, western options, eastern options, hot options, cold options, lots of variety.

Stayed for 2 nights in December as part of the last leg of our week-long holiday in Japan. As others have pointed out, location is certainly unbeatable - a block from the main artery of Shibuya - the Scramble, the shopping, the many restaurants - can't ask for a better located hotel. Shibuya is an ideal place to stay especially when travelling with young adults. We enjoyed the madness and excitement amidst the festive air - the quirky party bus, the Mario karts and not to mention, the occasional roaring of lamborghinis and Ferraris down the streets of Shibuya!Back to the hotel. Yes, rooms were small, typical of hotels of the similar price-range in Tokyo. We stayed in 2 twin-bedded rooms. At 16.2m2, the room layout was efficient, space was well utilised. No problem with having 2 big luggage bags in the room. We had a comfy place to rest to return to at the end of each evening. The level of service provided was nothing short of excellent. The front desk staff were most helpful to help us make dinner reservations on 23 and 24 Dec, which being super-peak season, were not easy to secure. But all was done with a smile. Luggage storage was also provided on the last day of our stay. Will I return? Definitely!

This hotel is extremely convenient with a convenience store right next doors and the train station across the street. This hotel is located in the heart of Shibuya, which made traveling very easy. The service was also great as the front greeted me good morning every morning and a welcome back when I come back. This small touch made me feel very welcome to this hotel. The breakfast was delicious and worth the price. There was even a lady that would make riceballs/ omelets on the spot for you. Overall I would book this hotel again in the future and would recommend this to anyone thinking of having a stay in Shibuya.

I booked online for @70 US dollars per night mo breakfast. Clean, comfortable and big beds, WiFi was fine. Great, great location right next to shibuya station (where you can take a NEX train direct to airport).

This hotel is probably the best hotel I stayed at throughout my whole stay in Japan. The room was the largest that we had (i think i booked 15m2, double from memory ). We had 2 big lugguage and 1 medium one and the whole room we were able to walk freely and open our luggage up! The location is very good, 2 min walk to shibuya station and 5 mins to the busy scramble crossing! So very ideal location! We were lucky our deal came with breaky. Breakfast was buffet which was nice to have a good spread of everything. The hotel provided free water which was great and our room was nice and clean everyday. The staff are very friendly and always greet you with a smile. I will definitely return here again and I would definitely recommend Tokyu rei hotel to anyone!

Rooms much bigger from other hotels nearby. Very reasonable price. Accessible to shopping area and restaurants. Hotel restaurant serve delicious food. If you love to eat noodles, there are two branch of Ichiran nearby. If you have time, you can get Hachiko Bus to roam around Shibuya and nearby places for Y100.

Breakfast is good, buffet. The rooms are small, typical of Tokyo’s room. They offer two bottles of water. It’s really close to Shibuya Station (2-5 minutes walk, depending the exit you use). Staff at the counter are nice and helpful, they all speak English. Downside is the objects are a little old and internet doesn’t work as expected. It’s worth the price since it’s really close to the station which makes traveling much more confortable and waking up with a nice breakfast lifts up the spirit!

The hotel was neat and very central. The train station was close enough to walk to. The rooms were small and we didn't have a window, but for one night, we cant complain. The breakfast was a good spread of Japanese food, eggs, chips, fruit, bacon, sausages, breads and cereals. It was included with our hotel deal so well worth it.

Good hotel, with decent size rooms that offers comfort. Breakfast offers choice and was a good start to the day. Location is central but it's very busy and noisy, lots to see in the area. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and we were really happy. The staff is so friendly (like most of the people in Japan). The breakfast buffet is amazing, you can get to try some Japanese specialities in the morning. The rooms are really small but you need to know that in Shibuya, you won't find easily a huge room ;)

This hotel is right next to Shibuya station, so easy to get to from airport (airport express goes directly there), and all subways. Real close to Yoyogi park, in fact you can get there by crossing just one street (and a few walkways over street). So not a hassle with traffic to get to park and then decent circular paths to run in the park. One note: don't run in the shrine area, it is forbidden. Room small but comfortable.

We stayed here with friends for 2 nights. This is a very busy area with various Metro lines, buses and JR trains. There was a bit of construction in the vicinity.The Hotel's Lobby is situated DOWN a set of escalators from the street level. The "Hush Hush" Restaurant will be on your left. Two banks of escalators across from Reception. Check in was very quick and friendly. The staff greet you as you pass by. Key cards are required inside the elevator to reach your floor.The room is a bit small, much like in Scandinavia. The Windows have a sliding printed screen that functions as artwork, window blackout shade and outside noise blocker. .Our room faced the train tracks. Once the sliding screen was in place, we barely heard the trains. The room was quiet. Unlike some hotels, the room doors do not slam shut and we could not hear our neighbors.As everyone mentioned, the room is small. There is a small desk with pull out stool and dorm-sized refrigerator tucked underneath. The most convenient feature is the electrical outlets and USB ports situated above the nightstand. The nightlights with dimmers is another convenience.The restaurant is dimly lit without those harsh fluorescent or LED lights. The Hostasks for your room number at breakfast and takes you to a table. There is a omelet station and large buffet selection. Definitely one of the best breakfasts that we have ever partaken. Overall, a very nice stay.

We (me and my wife) stayed 3 nights at the hotel. The hotel is centrally located near Shibuya station. The room we had (twin room) was small but clean and comfortable. The 2 twin beds were good and comfortable. The bathroom is standard but well equipped. Breakfast was great and offered both rich European and Japanese buffet. The hotel staff were helpful and courteous.Nearby attractions: Shibuya crossing (the busiest crossing in the world), Hachiko the dog statue, 109 building.

Good 3 Star Hotel with a good spread of Japanese buffet breakfast.Reception Service is good and the best point is its central location in Shibuya,just 5 mins to the train station.However rooms are small and air conditioning did not work well especially during the warm summer.

Small room but twin had 1 double and 1 large king single which was a lovely surprise. Great location, great buffet with both Eastern and Western foods, great, very helpful staff. Would highly recommend. It was a little hard to find.

Close to the train station with a subway entrance literally outside the hotel makes it a great location in bustling Shibuya with all shops and restaurants. Small room but nice bed and temple pillows, free water bottles, free wifi, Japanese toilet. Breakfast buffet at Hush Hush on B1F is a good start of the day with Japanese and Western buffet.

Great location, close to Shibuya station, small room but has everything you need but can be a problem if you have a large luggage, great breakfast buffet (lots of options and well worth the money), you can find cheap massage places about 10 min walk from the hotel.

A beautiful, competitively priced hotel in the heart of Shibuya - just a few hundred yards from the famous Shibuya Crossing and train station. You can walk to famous Harajuku in about 20 minutes. My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights for our anniversary. At check-in, you can store your luggage if you arrive early. You also may select several facial oils and cleansers for your relaxation in-room. Your room will come equipped with hair dryer, hair brush, tooth brush, slippers, shampoo and conditioner from Sheshiedo, and a cotton set of pajamas. The wall has USB outlets and standard Japanese outlets, which are extremely helpful. The bathroom is petite, but efficient. The room is extremely dark at night with blackout curtains, so you'll have a great night of rest. Massages can be purchased at an additional cost. Definitely select the breakfast option, which is one of the most expansive buffets I've seen at a hotel of this price. You can enjoy traditional Japanese fare (udon, miso, whitebait, tofu, salads) or Western (pastries, waffles, granola). Coffee, juices and assorted teas. The service is wonderful and would highly recommend.

Can't beat the location. Right near the corner, beside the BIC electronic store and McDonalds.Their room has a great blackout screen which blocks out the sunlight and noise is minimal considering it's location. Room was small but considering price point, it was reasonable. Bed was decent and clean.Air conditioning: While they do have adjustable controls, it will not go below 25 degrees. We set it to the lowest setting possible but it still was pretty warm. The AC works but not well. While we cannot say it was uncomfortable, we couldn't lower the temperature to what we hoped.Internet: free WIFI was good speed. Netflex was no issue. Very happy.Parking: It says on site parking available. What they neglect to mention is that on site parking is only for compact cars and smaller. Will not accept standard size cars, We by no means own a big car (Prius) but it was considered too big for their parking lot. We were given discount at a nearby shopping center but trying to get to these sites are a huge inconvenience if you can't read Japanese.

Location is fantastic - steps away from one of the Shibuya station exits , a convenience store, McDonald's, cafes and restaurants. The popular Hachiko meeting point is not far from the hotel too. Tokyu department store with everything you'll need is connected to Shibuya station . Note that the limousine bus doesn't stop here though , the closest is the stop at The Mark shopping mall, also connected to the Shibuya station on the other end , may take 10 min walking time. Like most hotels in Tokyo , the rooms are small. But the space is well thought out - mini bar, coffee making facilities , a little sofa bench and an ironing board . The Bathroom is even smaller - if you are from the US and it's your first time to Tokyo, prepare to be amazed ! But the range of toiletries is impressive - may even rival larger hotels ! (Word of caution - if you travel with large luggage , there may not be room for more than 1 piece of 28 inch luggage . )Breakfast is a very reasonable US 15 with a reasonable spread . Don't miss the freshly- made onigiri ( rice roll) , best i'e had .I would recommend this hotel . Only caveat is that this is a Japanese hotel chain and instructions in room for TV etc are only in Japanese . The reception staff were polite and helpful but things can get lost in translation .They don't have a dedicated concierge desk too, the front office desk doubles up as one . I didn't book any day tours with the hotel but do check if they can do so.

Stayed in room 701. First thing we noticed was that the air conditioning was busted. Asked native colleagues of ours to help explain that to the front desk - the front desk explained that the hotel just isn't cooled properly, and if a guest is uncomfortable in the hot room, they will give them a fan. Everything was covered in dust. Room had a smell. I have stayed in a lot of Asian hotels, and this was one of the worst. The room was also tiny. Tiny for Japanese standards. The bathroom is a pre-fitted all in one unit where everything drains into the tub. On the plus side, there are electrical plugs everywhere. Final note: avoid if you value your sanity. It's 410¥ to take a cab from the crossing to other, far superior hotels in the area that are not right at the crossing.

Located just around the corner from the Shibuya train station and the Shibuya Intersection (said to be the busiest intersection in the world). This hotel is a quiet refuge from all the hustle and bustle, Great Breakfast Buffet was included with the room.

It is located at a 2 min walk from the Shibuya station, so you are basically connected to all Tokyo through the train network. Besides, if you are not in the mood of taking a train, you are surrounded by many restaurants and commercial centers. And I am not even mentioning that the hotel has the most friendly staff you can find, they will always make you feel home. Breakfast is quite an experience here.Rooms are very clean, bathrooms are a little small but well equipped.In general lines, you will get extremely good quality service for your money and a huge plus for location.

The hotel location is great, just a few steps of walking form the subway. And it's very easy to get to the Shibuya intersection as well. The hotel room is nice & clean. Though the toilet is quite small but it fully well equipped, of course with bathtub as well.Registered to be hotel member and get complementary late checkout up to 1-2 PM, otherwise, the property's standard checkout time is 11.00 AM which is too early. The restaurant is nice but we didn't try hotel breakfast due to there are so many shopping mall surrounding including convenience store, Lawson 108, near by the hotel.

We stayed at Tokyu REI hotel for only one night as our hotel of choice (Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu) did not have any available rooms. Turns out both hotels are from the same hotel company! The rooms were small but it's to be expected from most Japanese hotels however the bathroom was extra tight! Felt like stepping into a tiny capsule. Despite that one negative everything was neat, clean and the added bonus was that Tempur pillows were provided. We stayed in Japan hotels for one month and I've got to say Hotel REI had the best pillows. Location is good as it's literally smack bang in Shibuya and very close to Shibuya station - very handy when you're travelling around Tokyo. Overall we had a pleasant stay but if you had a choice, go with Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu - location cannot be beat and the ambiance is very different despite being from the same hotel group.

The front desk will greet you with a genuine smile; and efficiently register your stay within minutes.Throughout my recent stay in Tokyu Rei, I was totally impressed by the level of efficiency and hospitality. The room is super clean, with complete amenities.I like the location - at the heart of Shibuya. The train and subway is just nearby. In fact, less than a minute from the front-door of the hotel.You will love the breakfast - the range was comprehensive. The food is so fresh and tasty.I will definitely return to this hotel on my next visit to Japan.

Pros:• Amazing breakfast. It is worth the price.• Sympathetic staff.• Really good location.Cons:• Dirty bathroom ceiling/walls/fan.• Dirty bedroom walls/air conditioning.• Staff can't speak that much english.• Upgrade is not upon availability / you will always need to pay for it, even if the hotel ain't full.• Really bad wifi connection.• Late check in.Advice: register to be a premium member and you will be able to have a late check out.

We stayed in a standard room for 4 nights, the hotel exceeded our expectations for the price we paid. The room was decent, very clean and the breakfast was spot on. The location of this hotel is fantastic, a 30sec walk out of the shibuya station. The hotel staff were great aswell. Would fully recommend.

We stayed in a Double room for 10 nights. We had researched before coming to Japan so expected a small room which is what we got. However it was a perfect base for travelling around Tokyo and was all we needed. There was a luggage stand by the door which kept our large suitcase out of the way. There is only room to walk around the bed but no need for more. our second smaller bag was kept on or under the built in seat next to the desk.Bathroom was small but functional. My husband is a big solid guy and didn't have any real issues. The bed is queen size. Mattress was harder than NZ hotels but I've now realised I like them better so I will be buying a new one...The buffet breakfast everyday was nice. Mixture of Asian/Western. I enjoyed the coffee, better than the $6+ coffees from cafes in Shibuya. BIC Camera is right next door for travel SIM cards. It also has an extensive chemist area. McDonald's and a Family Mart a few doors down either size. Coin laundry and vending machines in the hotel which we used. We got lost for a few minutes trying to find the hotel at first. I can't even remember now which exit to take. If you see Shibuya crossing head away from it under the train bridge past the Scramble Cafe/bar.

We stayed at the Shibuya Tokyu REI Hotel only for one night but now that I have been there, I would definitely go back again! The room is small like most Tokyo hotels but it's super clean and the beds are so comfortable. It's very close to Shibuya station about a 5min walk from scramble crossing.Highly recommended!

The hotel is right around the corner from Shibuya Crossing. It's right by the train station, which made it incredibly easy to travel around the city. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The rooms were clean. I had trouble turning off the air conditioning so the room was pretty cold. I set it to 85 degrees F and it was still chilly. I tried turning it off completely, but the maid kept turning it back on. I'll admit, it could have been user error and I didn't bother following up with the front desk. Overall, it was a minor inconvenience for the great location and service.

for me this kind of hotel im looking for & for sure every travelers or tourist will agree with me , a well organize and always have a freebies ^-^ at the lobby .Foods are great and also very near too.

We stayed at this hotel for several nights in April. The location is excellent, close to great restaurants and convenient to the train station. Our room was a good size, and had everything we needed. There is a laundry room in the hotel, but please note there is only one washer and dryer.The reason I am giving three stars is that we were unable to control the temperature in our room, and the room was unbearably hot for the entire stay. We made several calls to the front desk to try to resolve the issue. They sent someone up, but they were unable to fix the problem and suggested we use a fan. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Of all the things, their service - whether reception/housekeeping/restaurant staff - was the best. Very warm & accommodating! Just wish I knew what they would say in greeting everytime we entered the hotel so I could offer more than just a :) & a bow. Re: Room We stayed in a room that overlooked the railway & Hachiko Sq fr afar, fit 1 queen & 1 twin. Pretty tight but I suppose not bad for Tokyo. Enjoyed the more-than-usual amenities (room sprays, shoe brush, magnifying mirror, bathing towel/scrub, daily bottles of water, etc) & location was truly convenient. 30-40 mins fr Haneda Airport via Yamanote and Keikyu lines. Note that the hotel seems closest to the Shibuya train station Hachiko Sq exit. 15 mins to Roponggi and Omotesando via bus. Just get a PASMO (prepaid transpo card fr the airport) so you can freely use all bus and train lines. Their Hush Hush restaurant also offered delicious breakfast fr Japanese delicacies such as curry, rice with toppings to pretty well baked breads (the mini croissants!) Overall, would return!
