ninagonzalezzz
New York City, New York

review_body: I guess the title said it all. We didn't mind with how small the room was, because we stayed there only for sleep. This hotel is for those who want to spend their time outside all day, then get back at night and fell asleep. I was there on peak season, so that the price is quite expensive. But... it's only a minute away from station and because Shibuya is in the middle of the city, so when you travel around Tokyo with train, it wouldn't take a long trip. Around the hotel is so lively, whatever you looking for is there. Entertainment, food, fashion. Surely saved our energy and time.

Visited with hubby as part of a Titan" Essence of Japan" tour.The hotel is very conveniently placed if you are using the public transport services. However, we were on an expensive Titan tour and unfortunatley for the 5* prices we were paying this hotel did not live up to the usual standard we expect. There was nothing wrong with the hotel it is just not reflective of the prices we pay for a Titan holiday.Rooms were very small but clean and comfortable. However, the bathroom was beyond small with a high step up from the bedroom floor to the bathroom which felt more like entering a "port-a-loo"!We had to queue to get into breakfast - not impressed.Appreciate all the other comments on this site but not for us at the price we were paying.

very close to the placew we wanted to visit like the Shibuya crossing, hachiko statue, harajuku place ang the shopping district, breakfast buffet is overflowing with delicious foods, rooms were kinda small n can't go around, but its very clean, lots of amenities and quiet... recommendable...

Our group of 23 stayed here. If you're walking from the train station, the hotel might be easy to miss because it is between businesses and the entrance is nondescript. But, once you know that it's between the BIC store and Family Mart, you'll be fine. The location was perfect ---just across the street from the train station. We had some old people in the group and convenience was important. There are steep steps and an escalator down to the lobby area, so be careful with your heavy luggage. Their website said they have elevators and wheelchair access, but, I didn't see the elevator from the entrance area that we came in from. The buffet breakfast was delicious with a good variety of breads and real butter, sausage, bacon, salads, fruits, miso soup, rice and natto and other western and Japanese selections. I loved the freshly made onigiri (rice ball with fillings and crisp nori)! Our room was a typical compact and efficient Japanese hotel room, but, very clean. No great views, but, I was thrilled with the blossoming sakura next to the rail tracks. You can walk to Meiji Shrine, Yoyogi park and a lot of the shopping areas. There are lots of hole in the wall inexpensive places to eat all around. I would definitely stay here if we came back to Tokyo because of the convenience and accessibility and value.

The room was a bit smaller than expected. We stayed in a room that had a full size bed and there was enough room to walk around the bed. When we passed by some rooms with two twin size beds, those room seemed bigger and had a small couch right under the window. The bathroom has enough room for just one person and was not too fancy, but it was clean with a nicely warm bidet. Our room was right next to a main street, and it was not too noisy. The hotel location was awesome! It was right next to Shibuya station exit that connects to their underground subway central! So It worked out perfectly when it was raining and we just took a couple of steps right the subway. We purchased the stay with breakfast buffet, which was pretty good. They have your typical eggs, sausage and muffins, but they also have an Asian/ Japanese section. They have curry, soba, miso with a variety of toppings on the side. PLUS they have a corner where you can make your own pizza toast! Staff was super nice and they were able to hold our luggage the day of checkout until our PM flight.

The location of this hotel was perfect, it was literally one block away from the famous Shibuya crossing and was only a 4-5min walk from Shibuya station which was the main attribute we were looking for when searching for a hotel as walking on the streets with luggage sucks. Like any room in Tokyo, the room was small so if you are traveling with multiple luggage the room will be very tight. When booking your room, make sure to signify smoking or non smoking because if youre a non smoker stuck in a smoking room...you will not be happy.We did not opt for the breakfast as there are tons of options within the same block. We were able to ship our JR Rail Passes to the hotel without a problem. Would definitely stay at this hotel again purely for location. The trains stop operating at 1am, so if you plan to go out/club in the area be sure to pick a hotel within walking distance so you're not stuck with a $50 cab to get home.

I stayed at the Shibuya Tokyu REI for three nights on a recent business trip. The hotel was an ideal choice. The location is very convenient (exit #10 from the Shibuya Station is right outside the hotel door). The Yamanote line, the Narita Express, and various metro lines all stop at Shibuya.The staff were very helpful, and spoke a reasonable amount of English. The rooms are small, but have everything you need. I had a street-facing room, but did not find it noisy at all. There are vending machines and clothes washer and dryer on the 5th floor which was very useful.Everything was clean, and worked. It is not luxurious, but it is clean, comfortable and professional.

If you want a hotel that's super clean and in the best location possible this is the one! Ignore the one or two bad reviews you see on trip advisor. Yes the hotel rooms are small but they're super clean, good free wifi, kettle and hairdryer. The cleaners also do a great job of keeping the rooms spotless everyday. If you're like us and you're gonna be out most of the time seeing Tokyo and Japan this hotel is perfect. We checked out of this hotel today after an 8 day stay, and it was a lovely experience. It is pretty much as close to the heart of the city as you can get. It's right beside the train station so do expect some noise at night. If you want to stay this close to everything in any big city then a little noise is to be expected. Trust me though, it is only train tracks. It is not loud enough that it would keep you awake. There is also plenty of shops and lots of places to eat and drink right on your doorstep.The hotel staff don't get enough thanks on here! They all very pleasant and helpful and made our stay a great experience!Shibuya Tokyo REI... We will be back!

We have stayed twice in this hotel already in the last year and a half, and have enjoyed our stay both times.Rooms: As is typical for Tokyo hotel rooms, they are rather small but very functional and more than sufficient for our needs. Rooms very kept very clean and had the amenities we required.Location: Excellent location. Very close to Shibuya JR station (<2 minutes by walking) which is very convenient as you pretty much have access to the major train lines. Great location to use as a base for exploring Tokyo. There are also a lot of stores nearby, and the area is great for its nightlife, shopping, and dining.Overall, great value hotel especially for its location. We would definitely stay here again in the future.

Nice Hotel very nice reception area and meet and greet was friendly. Rooms tidy ,clean and beds comfortable . The Hotel I thought was close to restaurants and dining areas , also plenty of shopping malls around the area so all in all a nice place to stay for a few days. Plenty of supermarkets around the area so that came in handy for getting quick meals.

Pros- 1)the hotel is super convenient, near train station and all e district2) it is quite easy to locateCons- 1) this was the very first hotel that we hv stayed which did not even provide mineral water! This was something my husband and i could not accept. Mineral waters are the very basic and cheapest thing one hotel could offer. Even the cheapest hotel in bangkok offers that, i totally cannot accept that a Japan hotel has to be in this standard.2) please invest in your hair dryer. It was so old and slow and definitely not in working condition. Time for a change!

Stayed for a week at Shibuya Tokyo Rei hotel. My initial reason for the pick was because this hotel is located just across the street from Shibuya train station which makes it very convenient for travelling around tokyo. Got a double room and must say room is adequately spacious for 2 people with an attached comfy and clean bathroom. All the staff i met including the housekeepers were extremely polite and would greet me with a smile every time.Just down the street there is also family mart and BiC camera store for any electronics shopping.

This hotel is in the center of Shibuya. It is very convenient to get to places especially with Shibuya Station just right outside the hotel and is reachable within a minute. The reception's lack of knowledge on English and are very slow while we were checking in. Please request on changing the bed sheet if you have longer stay. Apart from the above, they are friendly and helpful. Getting to the hotel was easy as we just have to take a train (Keikyu line) from Haneda Airport heading for Shinagawa to Shibuya. At about 20 minutes, get of at Shinagawa Station and transfer to JR Yamanote . Look for JR line GREEN (Platform 1-2). Board the train on platform 2, heading for Shibuya Station. Another 20 minutes, get of at Shinjuku Station. If you miss the train, the next train will arrive in 3 minutes. Weekdays * Last train in Haneda 00:01Weekdays * Last train in Shinagawa 00:22Weekend * Last train in Haneda 00:02Weekend * Last train in Shinagawa 00:17

The hotel is in a great location; you can walk to most attractions within 10 minutes. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are small (which comes as no surprise) but well appointed and tidy and are priced decently for the area.

I booked a room using Travalgo and was asked by the Mandarin-speaking staff, Mr Yang if we wanted to do an upgrade. I was glad I did as the room was spacious and comfortable. It had a good view too, being on the highest floor. However, it can be rather frustrating to communicate with the staff as most are not able to converse in English effectively. The air-conditioner doesn't seem to work and a Japanese staff just noted it when we gave feedback. It could be due to some communication problems as he doesn't seem to intend to act on our feedback. Fortunately, Mr Yang whom we were able to communicate in Mandarin took the initiative to loan us a fan to improve air circulation in the room. That was a lifesaver! The breakfast buffet spread was rather limited, so it was disappointing. My husband loved the food though. The location is great, near shopping centres and the train station.

This hotel has a great location in Shibuya, really close to the metro. The price is good for the area, staff are superfriendly and the breakfast is good. The rooms are small and a bit outdated, but clean with all necessary equipment. We booked a non-smoking room, but it was clearly not (it smelled). When I complained they offered us a different room and they did a great cleaning job the second day which (almost) solved the problem. We will stay here again!

Just want to say that staff was really friendly & helpful. But room was really old & dirty. No AC in the rooms in November. So have to open the window & you can hear the trains running all night. Location was really convenient though. A minutes walk to the Shibuya crossing & subway entrance.Would not stay here again though. NEVER!

Had a nice room. It was on the small side but that's typical. The location was fantastic. Restaurant prices are high so I either ate breakie at McDonalds to the south or picked up food at the Family Mart to the north.

Receptionists were courteous, check in was fast. I liked the room. It is new, modern, clean and well lit. No creepy feeling. It was spacious (by Japan's standard), had a proper queen-size bed. The mattress was firm and the Tempur pillows supported the neck well. As my room faced another building, it was relatively quiet. We enjoyed good quality sleep. There is sofa by the window bay, writing desk and chair, LED reading light etc. The room had sufficient space for walking and to open up our big suitcases. Besides a kettle, they provided coffee, tea and mugs (not tiny tea cups). The bathroom was well-equipped with shower gel, shampoo, conditioner and facial foam. I don't like the Sanyo hairdryer which is attached to the wall. It was weak, so took some time to dry my medium length hair.. In general, the hotel is located in a convenient location. Few steps to the Tokyo Metro Shibuya subway station which connects to many lines. Cross the junction and it's the Shibuya JR station. Many malls in the vicinity too. Very accessible. We didn't buy the hotel's breakfast so I cannot comment on the food. I highly recommend this hotel, and i would definitely stay here when i visit Tokyo again.

Hotel Tokyu Rei in South West Tokyo small, however, excellent use of space and really well appointed, including a slimline torch on the wall by the bed. All amenities and toiletries excellent quality and plentiful with heated automated toilet/bidet and kimonos and slippers (Dave’s shrunk in the wardrobe). Very close to Shibuya Train station. 2 seater settee and writing table. Tea & Coffee.

The good:- Super location in the center of Shibuya! About 2 minutes walking to Shibuya station and Metro lines.- Family Mart is less than 1 minute away (Good place to buy breakfast).- Hotel staff is really nice and speaks English.- Wifi was very good - Fridge in the room- Washing machine on 5th floor.The bad:- Several very dusty places in room/bathroom we were surprised housekeeping didn't notice.- If you are tall, the bathroom is small. I am 181cm, and was very close to reach the ceiling with my head while showering. - Rooms are small, but this is normal for Tokyo. However, it will be tight when you bring 2 big suitcases like we did. - Only one washing machine to share. Would be nice with at least one more.Other:The bed is really hard, but I actually prefer that. Room had wifi, TV, A/C. Within 5 minutes walking distance, you'll find anything from konbini, izakaya, arcade center, electronic stores etc. This hotel is totally OK, and also because of its location, I can recommend it.

This hotel is located right outside Shibuya station which makes its location key if you're looking for easy access to a major artery. Hotel itself is clean and the rooms are small similar to all budget hotels in Japan. When we visited the AC was broken so we had to prop the windows open, aside from that it was an incident free stay. Staff was helpful and the internet speeds were not terrible.I would stay here again for the location alone.

Superb location for convenience and if you do not mind the crowds. Room is small, especially the bathroom. Only handful of TV channels with BBC the sole non Japanese channel. But what annoyed me most was the poor wifi daily during my stay.

It's a good hotel verz close to Shibuya Station, therefore in a busy area with plenty of things to do around. They have a breakfast menu for around 16$. The rooms are big enough (bathroom a bit small). The Wi-Fi is not the best.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while i was waiting to join a tour group. Very central to shibuya train station. A short walking distance. When i checked in the receptionist was very friendly and spoke good english. He checked me in quickly Rooms are small but as i was only there for 2 nights it was clean and very comfortable . Bathrooms are tiny but well stocked with toilteries slippers and yukata . Tea coffee were available ice machines vending machines were there . Did not eat inthe resturaunt but there are 7 eleven store Mc donalds cafes nearby.

My room, on the 8th floor, was small, Japanese small, compared to other, and cheaper, hotels I have stayed in in the area. But it's right in the heart of Shibuya - my room almost overlooked the famous Shibuya crossing. Being in the centre of the action comes at a price, it can be noisy. My room had wooden shutters which were very effective at shutting out the light, and only a little less so the sounds of the busy street below. Wifi was good. Breakfast was extra, unlike the other nearby hotels I've used, and not cheap so overall I found it to be not so great value for money, but great if you want to have the full-on Shibuya experience.

Really got a great location! I went on a business trip and it offers all the great components: great location, service, comfy room, free wi-fi, and TV. Just wish the room fee also includes breakfast :P

We were on a tour and this was the hotel chosen by the company. Very central for everything. Five minutes to the station and subway. A plethora of restaurants offering aĺl kinds of food.Staff were fantastic, couldn't have been more helpful. Several spoke excellent English.Rooms were very small and we had a lot of luggage, but we managed. Tiny bathroom but functional and a good supply of toiletries.Very buzzy at night. Would definitely recommend .

This was a tiny room but I think that it may be common for hotel of this grade in Tokyo. Barely room to move around the bed and bathroom was like an airline toilet! Ok slightly bigger! Bed was comfortable and room was reasonably quiet. We ate in the restaurant and the food was good. A short 2 minute walk to Shibuya Station and lots of shops and food outlets nearby. I give this an average rating as Tripadvisor does not have a 'good' rating which is what I would have preferred.

This hotel is on the heart of Tokyo. Best location. It's just. 1 min walk to the famous crossing and shopping hub. A 2 min walk to the station too. It has a washing machine and dryer on floor 5 and it's also got a bar and restaurant. The hotel rooms are tight but comfortable with all the amenities and charging stations a person could want and need. It's clean and modern and the staff are friendly. I loved the location and comfort for our trip and would stay here again.

It's hard to leave such a review as I've found, for the most part of my trip, excellent service everywhere. This hotel was no different in that I wasn't met with any rudeness but the helpfulness was on the low side and thus we feel we have been terribly inconvenienced. After our first night here I approached reception to see if someone could check the air conditioning in our room. It was ridiculously hot and stuffy and I figured something was wrong. I was told that because it was spring the air conditioning was set for that season and no cool air was available, I was also told to "just open the window". With how loud the streets are and the fact that the window specifically says not to open it, and couldn't anyway, we just had to put up with getting next to no sleep in our hotbox room. We had also planned to leave our big luggage here for one night while we stay at Disney, we would be checking out Thursday and returning to check in Friday. A friend of mine had done this previously without a problem but apparently this is no longer an option. Overall we're not happy with this hotel at all.

It is very near to Shibuya station and Shibuya crossing. Location is everything (for the reasonable price)! The amenities were adequate and the bed and pillow were comfy. I would also like to express a huge THANK YOU to Ms Mirei Tominagaa for her help in getting us to secure a room! I will definitely stay here again when I visit Tokyo!

Ok I get it, this is Tokyo. But the aircon only on heat cause its spring and with window slightly open the noise is aweful and with window closed still noisy and then you are too hot! Tiny rooms. Small bathroom. But great location right on rail line. And best Japanese restaurant we have been to around corner "Tora" and we have been to a lot. I guess if your young this hotel would be great. Not for mature coupes.

Stayed here for one night following a group tour through Japan. Staff were friendly and the hotel was very clean. Rooms were small and beds & pillows were quite hard however that is expected in most Japanese hotels. The hotel is central and very close to the Shibuya Station and pedestrian crossing. Thank you for a nice stay.

If you want to stay in the middle of the Shibuya buzz this is a great location. The positives:- Location, location, location.The negatives:- The shower / bathroom is made like a plastic cabin, and has a cheap feel to it.- The breakfast is not great. Great selection for Japanese style breakfast but very limited selection and poor quality on western style breakfast.- The front desk service is slow and their English is not great.Overall:You pay for the location and get nothing more.

I'm very satisfied to tokyo rei hotel this hotel is fantastic! I will highly recommend this hotel to others. First the location, the location is the bomb the station is just 5 min walk , shibuya crossing is just 2 min walk and all restaurant and malls are just 5 min walk and beside the hotel there is family mart its very convinient for your needs. Looby is good clean and nice their staff are nice and polite they can speak english, i can say our room is cozy and i really love their linens and comforter its all new and clean . However the problem in our room is wifi there is no wifi at all. But our room is great from linen to hot shower its all good . We did not try the buffet but its not expensive i think food is great because i can see lots of people eating. location is perfect if you're going to stay to Shibuya. but pls do something about your wifi connection. :)

Besides its location, location, location...accessibility to food, shopping, entertainment, train station...legendary hachiko statue...it is THE hotel with direct view of world renown Shibuya crossing.The hotel is clean, room is decent in terms of size.Faster than Bullet speed internet.Panoramic capsule elevators....for views.All in all, a good place to be based when visiting Tokyo.

Good choice for a base in Tokyo. No need to take the train to visit (or re-visit and re-revisit) Shibuya area. It is just minutes walk away to the scrambled intersection and to the JR train station as well. The walk is farther though if your train is coming from the airport. Look for the building with a big BIC sign and the hotel is on that row. Very, very small rooms, but not a surprise for Japan standard. Can fit 2 big luggages at most. And, of course, despite being small the room had a half bathtub. No need to bring toiletries except for lotion. The receptionists were very nice. We had a ticket delivered to the hotel and we received it without issues. We also left a parcel for a friend and they received it without issues as well. They offer a discounted rate for breakfast upon check in but we didn't take it. The rate was expensive during New Year's though. When you open the windows, you can hear the trains but not very loud.

Hotel is up to date, rooms aren't the warmest or that big but it did the trick and the location is very good! No computer or printer at hotel so that was a bit of a hassle but all in all it was a decent stay. Would I stay here again probably not but it was a reasonable stay

Good room, very clean. Bathroom smallish, as we are both 5''10 in height, but we managed. Rooms a re smallish but we were able to shove one bag in corner and another under chair. The hotel is very close to Shibuya crossing and all the eating and shopping areas, at times it was madness the amount of people that looted around there or off to do there thing. We did not eat at hotel, way to expensive. Subway close about five minute walk so was easy to get around to other areas and see Tokyo. I would def recommend the hotel for staying in as was very central. Could not hear anything from other rooms and staff pleasant. My only gripe is that you can't open windows and aircon on heting, it was so hot for a small room though I did manage to crack that window a small way open just enough for a slight breeze, but then you could hear all the noise from outside, but worth it for the fresh air.

This quite simple hotel has an almost perfect location in the Shibuya district. It's 200-300 meters from the famous Shibuya crossing and the Metro-station is just outside the doors. It's close to everything - shops, restaurants, bars and not far from the Yoyogipark or the Harajuku and Omote-Sando Districts. It's no fancy place but it is decent and the personell is very friendly and helpful. It's just one BUT - the rooms are extremely small. Think of a cruising ship cabin and you won't get disappointed. On the other hand, you hardly go to Tokyo to spend time in your hotel room.

Nice hotel, great staff and decent breakfast. The heated toilet seats were a bonus as well. I hope you enjoy the location as much as I did with hundreds of restaurants, clubs and shopping opportunities in the area.

My boyfriend and I stayed at Shibuya Tokyu REI for 6 nights in November 2015. We just wanted somewhere inexpensive (for Shibuya) while on holiday and so glad we chose this hotel. The room was very clean but quite small (to be expected- its Tokyo) but if you are like us and out of the room most of the day, then that's no issue at all. And wifi in the room was a bonus!The location is the best thing about this hotel- for Shibuya I doubt you'd find much better as it's just around the corner from Shibuya Station and Crossing. Even being so close to all this action, the room was quiet and we never felt like that was an issue. As a side note, woul definitely recommend staying in Shibuya it was a really fun area to be in.We didn't have much to do with the staff but all our interactions with them were very pleasant and they were very helpful. Overall, a great stay and would recommend for people wanting to stay in Shibuya!

The hotel is only 2 min walk from shibuya station. Very easy to find And convenient for travel in Tokyo And to/from narita with The narita express. Room is not big given The price but still a decent size for Tokyo. Staff at reception (especially women) are very helpful for non japanese speaker. They helped me with instructions for The laundromat And for filling The form for The luggage delivery. The reason why it does not get a 5 stars:- staff at The restaurant is just very rude. I Had diner once And The service was average. It felt that They were annoyed to have me here. Food was good though. - I just tried to see The breakfast Buffet this Morning And The Waiter (again) made me feel so uncomfortable that i didn t even stay... I am sorry I don t speak japanese, but I am seasoned traveller And believe I have respectful manners. I would encourage The management to train the restaurant staff better for international clients.

We were very happy with this hotel. The rooms were on the small size, which I understand is standard for Tokyo, but it suited our needs and was very comfortable. The staff were very helpful when we required assistance. The hotel was located very close to Shibuya station, which gave us very good access to the Tokyo metro so it was very easy to get around. The area also had very good local restaurants nearby and the ever-present Family Mart, which was handy for supplementary supplies. I can recommend the buffet breakfast, as it had a good range of food in a lovely setting. The only negative part of our stay was the room air-conditioning couldn't be set below 20 degrees C, so at night the room was a little warm for us, but this was minor. I would recommend this hotel as a great place to stay.

I visited the Tokyu Rei Hotel on a school trip to Japan with 60 kids! The rooms were very small and you had to use your space wisely. However they have free wifi and lots of vending machines. The staff are very friendly and I LOVED the food. It's in a very convenient location close to lots of tourist attractions/restaurants/shops and more. If your looking for a big hotel room this isn't for you, but if your looking for a nice cosy hotel room this is a great place!

First of all maybe it's really good value for your money, considering the location.I felt though that the room was stuffy, quite small. I was alone - maybe a single room is smaller, not sure. Also the bathroom felt to me like airplane lavatories LOL. Plastic-like and a little old. It wasn't expensive though, the location couldn't get better really, the hotel staff was nice.I think I would try for another hotel though, if could find in a reasonable price next time.

Best hotel to stay in while you are in Tokyo, this hotel has the most cheap prices around Shibuya area. It's very close from the station just 1 or 2 minute walk And very convenient to move to other districts. A lot of restaurants, night life, karaokes, shopping mall, casinos and everything near by, the hotel staff where really kind and helped us with everything (they do speak english) also the restaurant was good.

Access and location is probably one small step below Tokyu Excel, but overall a great location and good value. Staff was helpful to me but didn't have much interaction with them. When budget allows it, I would pick excel just because it's a little nicer all around, but happy to stay here when looking to save a little on the budget!

The hotel room was very clean. The room came with an air purifier and AC. Very efficient use of space. The double size bed was against the wall (could be an issue for some people if there's 2 of them in the bed). The room also came with a mini fridge, kettle, pyjamas. Even though it's pretty close to train tracks, I did not hear any of the trains, it was well insulated from outside noise. However the walls are thin and was woken up by an alarm next door (oddly enough the alarm didn't wake the person in that room, 20mins later it was still on and we had to knock on the wall to wake up the person next door to turn it off) The bathroom was very small, no counter space. The shower was nice and hot with very good water pressure. They had the following amenities in the bathroom: shampoo, hair conditioner, body wash, hand wash, toothbrush and toothpaste, hair brush, razor and saving cream, hair brush, cotton pad and cotton tips, shower cap, and hair dryer (thought it didn't work very well). They had 1 laundry machine and 1 dryer. They also had a vending machine selling drinks. The reception desk was very friendly, spoke enough English for us to get by. I would book this hotel again if I go back to Tokyo.

Staff very polite and speak basic English. Rooms were basic no microwave and to watch tv you had to pay extra so we didn't bother but other than that it was great. Excellent location for Shibuya station. Everything within easy reach to get to quickly. Hotel was clean and well maintained. Had washing facilities and vending machines

We are travelling around Japan using the JR rail pass. Our first stop was Shabuya and stayed at the Tokyu Inn for 3 nights.We are going to Niigata, Takamaya, Kyoto, Hiroshima, Tokushima and Nigita and then to South Korea (Seoul and Busan).The hotel staff are very nice and the hotel is close to the railway station. Plenty of restaurants nearby.You can catch a train from the airport to Chabuya station and walk with your bags to the hotel. Get a JR rail pass before you go to Japan. Great value for travelling around and JR ticket offices make it all easy with little language needed. B

Hotel was in a great location & close to Shibuya station & crossing. Hotel staff were extremely friendly & helpful. We had 2 large suitcases & 1 small one, so had to organise the room to fit everything in but had expected a small hotel room so wasn't a problem. Bathroom was very well supplied with amenities. We saw into twin rooms being cleaned & these looked as if they may have had a bit more space. Had breakfast in Hush Hush restaurant but wasn't a huge selection so only ate here once. We were very happy with the hotel for the price we paid & would happily stay again. A tip re ATM's - only ATM's in 7 Eleven's accept foreign Eftpos / Debit cards to withdraw cash.

Overall Shibuya Tokyo Inn is a good choice of hotel in Shibuya area. To share my notes from our 3 nights stay here.Location Notes:- Hachiko Exit #10 is just a few steps away from hotel entrance- BIC Camera dept store and McDonalds right around the corner - these can serve as your landmarks when locating the hotel for the first time.- Family Mart is a short walk , only about 3 bldgs away. It is NOT right next door as mentioned in one of the reviews posted.- About 5 mins walk to Shibuya Crossing.Room Notes:- No need to bring toiletries as hotel provides big bottles (dispensers) of Kanebo shampoo, conditioner, body wash. Of course you can't bring them out of the room.- As with typical Japanese hotel toilets, it is very small but designed nicely. - With hot/cold shower and small bath tub. Water pressure good.- Hair dryer power very weak - quite useless if you ask me, so if you're the type who can't go out without blow-dried hair then I suggest you bring your own.- Very thoughtful of the hotel to put a multi-plug charger attached to the wall beside the bed. This charger has USB, micro-USB, and all sorts of plug heads (not sure what the right term is) so very handy for your gadgets.- There's a ref and water pot/kettle. - Coin laundry, drinks and noodle vendo, and free ice dispenser on the 5F- Shoe brush, coat hangers, communal slippers available in room.Lobby staff very courteous as well. We rented a wifi unit which we requested to be shipped to the hotel and it was there when we arrived for check-in.Hotel lobby is on the basement, so after entering the hotel entrance on the street you have to take the narrow escalator downwards. But a large luggage will fit the escalator don't worry. Will be quite inconvenient if you are carrying a lot of big bags though.I noticed that it's common for Japanese hotels to NOT provide complimentary water bottles and no vaults in the room - so far based on the 2 hotels we stayed in Japan.

The location can't be beat, easy stroll to the train station. Plenty of great restaurants/bars and entertainment within walking distance.Service was great. We spoke very little Japanese but it was very easy to communicate with hotel staff.The hotel rooms are small which is the norm in Japan. Very comfortable beds.Washer and dryer available.For the price of this hotel you can't go wrong.

For the location, Shibuya Tokyu Inn CANNOT be beat! The service was spectacular, they offered 80,000 yen in Amazon Japan gift cards upon check-in (Note: You can order right away and get it shipped to the lockers at the convenience store a few doors down). The hotel rooms itself is typical for Japan size. They offer robes and a range of amenities within the room. The rooms were small and the a/c I can see being a bit difficult for those who don't understand or read Japanese. Overall, it was a pleasant stay and I would not mind staying here again.

It was a little on the small side but it was charming. The staff were friendly, great location and we definitely took a shining to it. Very clean! Will definitely stay here again!! Laundry facilities and vending machines on premises were a God send!!

First of all you must remember this is Japan, the rooms ARE going to be tiny. Second of all this hotel is cheap! amazing price for this convenient location. Shibuya is accessible from the Airport by NEX, and many metro lines and JR line. Great area to live in and great hotel to pick! Beds made every day, rooms very clean and has all basic amenities. Staff were really nice and helpful! Well, except when I asked for their suggestion for a place for BBQ they referred me to a korean BBQ restaurant (hello? what tourist would want to have Korean BBQ in Japan?!)Just a point to note: the walls are quite thin so we could sometimes hear other visitors walking past the corridor when they are loud.

Rooms were small but we really didn't mind. We initially booked a single room (that was the only one left on the website), but asked for an upgrade when we checked in. Normal check out time is 10am but, again, late check out of 12nn can be requested if you ask nicely. There's free internet in the rooms but connectivity/reception is pretty bad. Bathroom was ok but the bed was really comfortable.The best thing about the hotel is its excellent location. it's just a few minutes walk to the famous Shibuya Crossing. It's great. Our booking didn't come with breakfast but we didn't really mind. There are a lot of food places around that area.

If you're looking for the best location in Shibuya... this is the best place to stay. I had a 20 hr overlay in Tokyo and a friend recommended this hotel. Easy to locate and right next to the famous crosswalk to Tokyo. The neighborhood is alive at night! Tons to see and do. Full of restaurants and accessible with public transportation.

This as our third time in Tokyo and wanted to stay in Shibuya this time - due to the price location combination we chose the Tokyu Inn. Given the number of Japanese business hotels we have stayed at (see other reviews) we though the risk of disappointment would be low as they are general of good quality. We were very disappointed - primarily due to the complete lack of comfort of the bed (worst we have ever had in Japan), general cleanliness (smell of food etc) and the noise levels from other rooms. We realize you can not expect the world at these prices in Shibuya however last time we stayed at the Sunroute Plaza (Great Location in Shinjuku) at a same price point and this is better on every element. Two stars and not one because of the price/location combination.

Excellent location, near by you can find lots of restaurants, clubs, shopping malls, etc., totally busy and packed up location 24/7Very much easy accessible to the railway station.Very good restaurant and welcoming reception staff.Rooms are slight small. But everything else was fine.

What has not been said about this hotel in other reviews? Excellent location, easy access to Rail station, Family Mart, Shibuya Crossing, shopping and post office.The rooms were cozy and quiet and the amenities provided were excellent. There would not be any issues with me staying here again.

Whenever i travel to japan, i always have to stay in shibuya, so ive stayed in more than 10hotels in shibuya, and tokyu inn is my fave hotel after granbell :)Location wise, its just a perfect, couple of mins walk to JR, and located right in front of exit 11 of tokyo metro. Family mart is just next door.Room, as what you could expect from japan hotel room, tiny LOL but its enough if you travel solo. Wifi in the room was okay, breakfast was decent, better than most 3 stars hotel that provided free breakkie tbh.The front desk girl was so kind and cheerful :)

First off, they have free wifi.Spent a night here in October and I must say that for the location and price, this hotel is definitely worth it! I would absolutely, in a heart beat stay at this hotel again. It's not fancy and the elevator is old but but the view in the room is spectacular and the rooms are very clean. The bathroom is small but it's normal compared to most hotels in Tokyo.The room is clean but a little outdated. The staff is extremely nice!Overall it was an awesome hotel and I would most definitely recommend this place to anyone else planning to visit Tokyo.

The Shibuya Tokyu Inn has the perfect location especially if you want to be in Shibuya. It's less than a minute walk to the Shibuya station exit #10, 5 minute walk to the famous crossing and Shibuya 109. The room we booked was perfect for us two (couple), it had a fridge (to store drinks, snacks), bed was comfortable, and a nice clean bathroom. I really love the small bath tub. The staffs are very friendly and attentive, and there are brochures around the hotel for different things to do around Tokyo. Also, there's a convenient store nearby about 2 minute walk (Family Mart). There's also a Taito station (arcade) nearby, so if you like playing video games then its just right next door.I deducted 1 less because the free wifi is very very slow. Sometimes it doesn't even connect. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at Shibuya Tokyu Inn, When I visit Tokyo I would want to stay here again.
