Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel is almost in front of exit number 10 of shibuya station. Be aware that shibuya station is passing through a big remodeling, so you may be forced to go up or downstairs with your luggage if you are arriving by narita express. The narita express location is near the south exit, so it is a little far from the hotel's exit.The hotel has good WiFi that works great inside the room. The hotel seems to be a little old and the TV selection is very limited. But the location makes it a very good pick. The pillows are super comfortable (tempur), but the bed is a little hard.

I love the location, near the jr station and super near to shibuya hot-spot.This was my second time i stayd in this hotel. And i feel the same, the room is ok, the bath is not super good, the wather didnt mix well so i got some cold moments. And i could hear the maids washing the upper flor and the next rooms. even heard other guest talk in their room. But! I was traveling alone and i dont go to hotels to stay there, and this works perfectly! If you love night-life, you should stay in shinsjuku. If i dont find something in the same price i will come back, agen.

Stayed here for 8 nights. The rooms are pretty small, consisting mostly of bed. Trying to fit our luggage was a hassle since both of us are pretty chaotic and messy with our stuff (picture overflowing open suitcases with clothes radiating out from each bag), but it turned out to be a good lesson in keeping tidy.That being said, the rooms are clean, comfortable, and perfect for returning to each day and getting a good night's rest. I have no complaints.We had breakfast downstairs each morning, which consists of a buffet style spread. There's a lot of options but many are meat-based, so not a lot of options for the non-meat eating crowd. There were salad, eggs, breads and rice every morning, though, so while we didn't get a lot of variety in our breakfast, we were able to eat breakfast without complaint. Used the laundry machines on the 5th floor in the auto-vend room a couple times. I had no idea what buttons I was pressing since I can't read Japanese but my clothes came out clean and nothing horrible happened, so that was nice. Also, the auto vend room has a nice selection of drinks!The hotel staff really helped us out in so many ways and I must thank them! At one point we needed to find an english-speaking doctor (neither of us speak any Japanese beyond basic phrases), as we were afraid one of us had contracted strep. Front desk staff spent at least 30 minutes calling around and found us a doctor who spoke english, and provided a map and walking instructions.

Was in Tokyo for three nights and picked this place based on price. Was pleasantly surprised at the fantastic location, less than 5 min walk from the famous Shibuya Crossing. It was also right in the heart of all the shopping and food at Shibuya. Convenience store close by to buy drinks and snacks. Also good access to the buses and trains.Rooms are small but this is the norm and given the price still value. The bed size was a normal sized double (Australia). Stayed in a non-smoking room facing the main street and didn't have any problems sleeping over the weekend. Service was nice and they had baggage storage on our last day after we checked out as we had an evening flight.The buses to the airport is about a 10 minute walk which isn't far but its a very busy place to lugging bags around. Other than that though I had a very enjoyable stay.

Stayed here for our first three nights in Japan. The room was much smaller than I thought, especially by American standards. There is no free space, but we made it work. Location was perfect for shibuya and nearby exploring- 5 minute walk to restaurants, trains, and the famous crossing. You can't beat the price for the location. Free wifi with strong signal. I would certainly book here again.

My first time in Shibuya and Tokyo, I choose this hotel for the price and location. It made my trip easier and spent more time enoying Shibuya shopping, restaurants and culture. The hotel is nice and clean. Front desk very hospitable and helpfull. The room I had was for 2 and its basically set up like a cruise ship room, it was cool room. A/C working fine, hot water working, TV all japanese. 1.5 hrs to take the express train from terminal 1 Narita Airport. The train station is like a maze, just follow everyone out, they're all headed to the mall that connects with train station and Tokyu Inn is around the corner. The young kids all look like Anime that comes to life. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again. Have a great time in Shibuya, Sha, Sha Shibyua!

This hotel is great. As an American I walked in not knowing what to expect, but the front desk was able to get me in despite our language barrier. Of course they did speak enough English to make things easier, which was awesome. As for the hotel itself the room is about a studio single you would expect out of college, but for the price and location it was well worth it. It was located directly 1 block from the shibuya crossing, and by block I mean a small block. Also, if your going to be traveling and exploring the room is perfect to come back to and just crash. Your also on the street side, so you can experience the night life of Tokyo which is awesome. Close to everything. Didn't explore for a gym but the place is great and awesome for a traveler looking to be in the middle everything. There is a metro station entrance right outside so you have access to all exploration. Will stay here everytime I need a downtown hotel!

Hotel is a few minutes walk from the famous Shibuya crossing and several train stations. It is 20 minutes away from the Meiji shrine. Rooms are clean but really small that if a suitcase is opened up, walking around the room is a challenge. Bathroom walls are amost 2 arms-length apart that you can reach toiletries from anywhere in the bathroom space. Room aircon was not working well in the room I stayed in. Hotel staff are courteous and accommodating.No free breakfast but there's free internet and access is fast.

Stayed four nights at this "no frills " hotel due to its excellent location in Shibuya. The rooms were modern, clean and tidy. Lets start with good:Location very central.Staff was very friendly.Rooms were tiny but have a fresh look and clean.So what is the bad point about this hotel? I have stayed in airport hotels with tiny rooms but there is one big problem with the rooms here.....I cannot find a single draw to put away my clothes or toiletries and there are only space for six hangers for two persons.I can accept tiny rooms that are functional but to have no draws and limited hanging space in a very tiny room makes life very difficult. The person who designed the rooms must not have seen what a chest of draws looks like.This design fault is the only complaint I have in a otherwise good hotel.

We had a 3-day stay here and had a mixed experience. The rooms were very tiny. Bathrooms felt like being in a boat (very cramped). However, the amenities were very good and nothing can beat the location. Value for money - not that great, but if you want to get around the city, Shibuya station allows you very good connectivity.

Stayed here with a friend, twin single beds and non smoking. Really easy to find, right by Shibuya Station exit 10 and a $10 taxi from Roppongi night life (Shibuya also has its own nightlife too). Mcdonalds and a family mart either side. Also a fantastic french cafe across the road. Seibu and major shopping in the buildings behind. Booked through hotels.com. Really can't beat it. I also stayed and paid more for Shinjuku washington and this was far superior and bigger for tokyo standards (tokyo rooms are very small). I recommend for family and friends. Not very luxurious though as it's a business hotel but it's cheap! The staff spoke perfect english when i was there and kindly stored luggage before and after our stay. No english speaking tv but if you're watching tv in Tokyo you're doing it wrong. Will stay again!
user_name:
Amanda N
Auckland, Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: The hotel is close to the train station, shopping and lots of restaurants. This was our first time in Japan and a friend booked the hotel for us due to its proximity in the city. The a/c in the room was not working. Not sure how to work it but decided to make do and just stay put for 3 days. The price of the room was very reasonable, but I guess you get what you pay for. The bathroom was so small like it belonged in a cabin of a cruise ship. The room was very small and there was no closet, just a bar to hang clothes and a shelf behind the entry door. There are no safes in the room and I went to the front desk to keep my valuables. I was handed a large paper envelope and as told to put my valuables in there which the clerk folded and placed on a shelf under the front desk counter. I walked away puzzled and figured I should just keep my things in my room, which I did. The hotel is located about 2 minutes from the Shibuya train station and about 3 minutes from lots of shopping. It was very convenient to get to the train and go anywhere in Tokyo. Each morning and afternoon the city came to life with thousands of people on their way to or from work. The hotel is literally close to the city center which I appreciated. We ventured out each morning to the train station and in the afternoon/evenings we went shopping and ate at nearby restaurants. The one saving grace for this hotel is the restaurant in the lobby. We had breakfast there 1 morning and there was a pretty good buffet. They have miso soup, bacon, rice, omelet, bread, pickled plums and fish. It was a japanese/american buffet which I thought was great. We had dinner there with a couple of friends who live in Yokohama and just ordered the special which turned out to be octopus curry. It was so tasty! I had never had octopus ink before and it was great. I love the texture of squid and octopus and really enjoyed this dish. In fact, I still think of that curry til today. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a vacation but more for business and definitely only for 1 or 2 days at the most.

Glad I hadn't read the previous reviews after I booked this hotel (having read reviews prior to November. I booked it early). The air con was working so it was perfect temperature as I could set it myself. Staff spoke very little English but that is common across Japan so I don't see why people complain about that. You come to a country not knowing the language, expect some difficulties (I speak zero Japanese, but managed fine!). The room was small and compact but suitable for sleeping (quiet and comfy). There is a floor with ice and food and drink vending machines. No room service (not really required though in Tokyo when there is so much choice). Perfect location. Close to shops and the train. Short and simple walk to Harajuku as well. Would stay here again for the price it was. Also had a non smoking room and didn't suffer from any issues.

I read the review of this hotel before booked it for 7 days of our stay in Japan. Most reviews said this is best for its location though this is not the hotel that you will remember as a great place to stay, so I did not expect anything superb for this hotel, as long as its a strategic location with restaurants, family mart and shopping districts nearby, and near to subway, its good enough for us who was travelling with 2 year old toddler. Surprisingly it was far worst than my low expectation. The air conditioner was not working so we told the receptionist,p with the though that it may just happened to our room, and we were told that THEY DID IT IN PURPOSE AS IN THEY TURNED OFF THE AIR CON FOR THE WHOLE BUILDING SINCE THE WEATHER OUTSIDE IS NOT HOT, so the guests dont need air con. They offered us a fan to use. What a shame, we paid more than hundreds dollars per night and expect nothing but the ordinary hotel with some basic services includes air conditioner. AND they told us to open the window to get fresh air so we had no choice. We ended up with sleeping uncomfortably as we could heard the sound of trains, musics etc so loudly from the hotel room.I wouldnt come back to stay nor recommend this hotel. The staff didnt speak English at all and they werent friendly and helpful. Also, we asked for non smoking room since we stayed with a little kid, but they gave us a room where you can smell a strong cigarette smoke just right the very first step to the room. We complaint but the staff didnt put some efforts to find another room, as they said it was full. No apologise at all.

We stayed last week (mid oct 2013). The worst ever hotel in my entire life so far:1) since the weather was quite cool on the outside (18 celcius), the air con in the rooms were switched off purposedly. When we asked to turn it on, the told us to just open the window in our room! 2) we were given a room that smelled cigarette so bad although they called it non-smoking room. Imagine having a 2 yr old with us and stayed in a room smelled cigarette so bad.Overall, if you're planning to stay transit for 1 nite only, the price MIGHT be worth it for you. Otherwise, i suggest picking a different hotel. This ain't a hotel, like the name says, 'inn', it's actually a motel standard!

This hotel is right in the middle of the action in Shibuya. It is a good value hotel. No frills, and a great place to lay your head. Let's face it, if you go to Tokyo you won't spend a lot of time in a hotel room. We didn't anyway. We found the staff helpful, although I wish I had rented a sim card at the airport when I arrived. It would have made it easier to navigate the streets. The hotel is good, and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. Subway station is also nearby. The rooms are extremely small. Barely fit me and my girlfriend with our two bags. It was a tight squeeze. We are both skinny people. I would say if you are large, or have big stomach bones (and there two of you) you will probably need two rooms. The beds are small double beds. Two large westerners would not fit. Larger folks might want to try for a larger room, or another hotel.

The hotel is in an excellent location for exploring Tokyo in close proximity to Shibuya station. The room was small but adequate as per the usual standards in Japan. Although the staff spoke limited English we found them very helpful. (We arrived on a morning flight and they let us check in early!) Overall we found the hotel to be good value for the excellent location.

This was the perfect room for me. I stayed for 5 nights. Although it is small, it is exactly what you need. Wi-Fi, bed, friedge, iron-table, bathroom, and everything else you expect out of a room located in the MIDDLE of downtown Shibuya. This is only a 20 second walk out of the lobby to the famous Shibuya Crossing, so you are near everything. Plus, even being in such a busy area noise is not a issue. I will be staying here again!
user_name:
Justin Y
Seattle, Washington, United States

review_body: This hotel is located very close to the Shibuya station, which makes it easy to get around.It's also located close to shopping malls, Shibuya crossing and the Hachico statue.The rooms are totally fine, although a bit small, but not any smaller than other hotel rooms in tokyo. All in all, staying there was a great experience.

This hotel is well-located for visiting the Shibuya area with its shopping street and hectic life. From here you can visit Nakano, Yoyogi just walking and when you take the metro, you can visit the fish market early in the morning. The hotel is perfect for sleeping and the breakfast is very good. All is clean and service is correct. But it is not a hotel that will stay in your mind. Rooms are small and the corridors are a little bit dark and warm. One evening when it was raining and the children were tired, we decided to have dinner in the hotel. After some explanations, it became clear that the content of the dinner (fish or meat) was not what they displayed (fish and meat). So we decided to cancel our order and have dinner in one of the restaurants nearby (for ¼ of the price).

Stayed one night and would definitely stay again. The rooms may be small, but you are right in the midst of Shibuya and just down the road from the train station so the only time you should be spending in your room is to sleep! Staff were friendly, and even minded our bags until 10pm even though we had checked out that morning and were waiting for a night bus. Even though the hotel is so close to the huge train station it is very quiet. A really convenient, clean and tidy hotel!

Stayed one night but would definitely consider staying here again. The location is great, about 2 minutes walk from Shibuya Station with our wheeled luggage. We took the NEX from Narita and found the East exit towards the hotel. This is also where the bus terminal is located, so you can follow the signs for the buses. When you exit, look for the Clarion sign at the top of the building across the street and the hotel is on the right side of that building near a McDonald's.We arrived at 11pm but check-in was quick. The room we were given was small - double sized bed against the wall with a teeny-weeny ledge on the other side for a lamp and clock. There were no curtains but a sliding panel with Japanese scenery to close the window. There was a desk along the full length of the wall below the window, a small ref and a coffeemaker. No drawers but a small clothes hanger was available.Staff were very helpful and allowed us to leave our luggage till 3pm the next day while we explored Shibuya. When we returned to pickup our luggage and to take a taxi, one of the staff at the Front Desk actually walked to the curb with us to hail our taxi.There was breakfast available in their restaurant and the front desk will offer a discount for the buffet at Y1300.

I stayed here for 4 nights with a friend while we explored Tokyo and we were very happy with our stay. The room was small, like everyone has said, but it wasn't so bad. We both had a twin bed (which was a little uncomfortable, but still fine), a small bathroom, a small desk and then some room to walk around in. It was clean, pretty quiet, affordable, and very close to the Shibuya station (for both subways and the JR line). I would definitely stay here again if I return to Tokyo. Also, I saw a lot of comments about not having wifi - but they definitely did have it in our room for free during our stay and it worked perfectly.

It's a 3 minutes walk from the hotel to the JR & Metro Stations and also the world's busiest crossing. The room is small but sufficient for 2 adults with 1 big and 2 small luggages. The bed is very comfortable (I think it's the memory foam type) but they could have provided nicer pillows. It was very quiet even though our room was facing the main road. Perfect!! The main pro for this hotel is the location. The con however includes ciggies smelling rooms. I guess it doesn't matter if you've requested for a non-smoking room as the Japanese are notorious in smoking and the smell is all in the central air-conditioning system. Just use the air freshener provided in the room whenever you enter/leave the room. It should smell fresher by the next day.

Stayed 3 nights in twin room in this lovely hotel, first time in Tokyo. Location is very good, in central Shibuya, 1minute walk from Shibuya train station (central south exit). Rooms are small but very convenient, equipped more than many european hotels. Plug adapters available at reception. Vending machines with cold and hot food and drinks available on fifth floor at normal, store prices.Hotel staff very courteous and friendly.Overall my best stay in a 3* hotel so far.

The hotel location was great! Everything was in close reach and this made eating out and walking to the train station very easy. No air-con made our stay a little uncomfortable and it was hard to sleep, the staff said they don't have air-con in this season? (wasnt sure why? to save power perhaps?) Overall would stay again based on location.

This hotel was recommended by a friend, and we spent 3 nights here in Feb. Conveniently located just across the road from the Shibuya JR station, and a stone's throw from the main street of Shibuya, it is accessible to all the action on Shibuya minus quite a bit of the noise and traffic.The rooms are really small, barely enough space for a not-quite Queen bed and a bit of space on the side to walk. The bathroom / toilet was rather cramped, so if you have a large build, then perhaps look elsewhere. There was just enough space for a small bath tub, which was flanked by a small sink and with the toilet bowl right up against the sink (kinda like the toilet on a boat). After the initial impression of "wow, this is small" wore off, we actually found it cozy, and we spend most of the time out of the room anyway, only returning to shower and sleep, so it was fine. Despite the small size, it was well furnished, the bed was comfortable, and opening the window allowed some cool winter air in (though you get a bit of road and traffic noise as well). A LAN port and cable is provided for internet and they even provided a multi-charger for most mobile phones on the tiny bed-side table. There wasn't a safe in the room, so we just locked our passports in one of the luggage.Service was run of the mill, no complaints and they even assisted with arranging a courier to have our excess luggage delivered to our onward hotel.

Wonderful location but the rooms and beds are extremely small - even by Japanese standards. We had to turn sideways to get between the bed and the wall and i am definitely not large! We chose this location so we could walk to Meiji Shrine on New Year's Eve and not have to worry about getting back on the trains and it worked really well. But I don't know if I would stay again - I think I would pay a little more for a room where I could unpack a few items into a drawer and have enough space on the floor to open my suitcase.

Small room, but so is many things in Japan. Everything was clean and had everything I needed! Best of all, right smack in Shibuya! Heeeellllo! Robes, toiletries, and indoor slippers are provided in your room.(travelled in July 2010)

We stayed here for 6 nights and it is so convenient to about 4 or 5 different train & subway lines. 200 metres from Shibuya Crossing as well. Lots of cute bars, food stalls and traditional japanese restaurants around the area plus lots of shopping stores. The hotel staff were so nice and helpful, always smiling and saying hi. Room was average size, but quiet decent for japanese sized rooms. TV, Air con and nice bathroom. Room always cleaned and not too noisy either. Over all very convenient and would happily stay here again for a fairly priced place in a popular area of Tokyo city. would stay here again!!

It was the first time for me to arrive in Tokyo. Prices are outrageous, but the city is stunning!This hotel was booked for me, mainly for its value and location. About 200 US dollars per night for nothing more than a battery cage with a build in bath room is apparently a good deal...The room was so small that I had no place to open a second suitcase. Everything in the room was mini, but it worked. Internet was fast and for free. The mini-bar was empty though and a coffee downstairs was 10 dollars(!). The breakfast in the restaurant was nice but not outstanding.The bathroom was entirely plastic and a build in model. Very efficient probably, but I felt like being in a camper on a camping place.The hotel's best asset is its location at only 3 minutes walking from the Shibuya train/subway station.

We stayed here primarily for the location, and we weren't disappointed. It's right in the middle of the huge shopping district of Shibuya, a few blocks from the main station. That meant that getting around Tokyo was easy, and we could always find food (or whatever else we needed) nearby. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Wired internet in the room, air conditioning, vending machines (with beer), refrigerator, nice staff. There's a restaurant on the first floor serving "euro" food; we didn't go in, and it looked kind of expensive. This was a great way to start our trip to Japan.

We stayed in this hotel for a few nights and it was very convenient that it was steps away from the station. This was great since we were towing heavy luggages around. The check in was fast and the staff helpful with our questions. Aside from the weird stains in the hall, the room was quite clean. It was also great that they have the option of being "green". We weren't expecting a big room but the space was sufficient for two people - especially since we're out most of the day anyway. A few minutes of walking, and we're in Shibuya crossing.

On the edge of Shibuya city center, it is nice to be in a little quieter area but still be able to go into the crazy Shibuya area within 5 minutes. Fairly big rooms for Tokyo and this hotel is definitely a good deal! One of the bad things is that check in is a little late.

I was looking for a cheap stay for 6 days. Low expectations, just needed a roof over my head. This hotel is reasonably quiet but streetnoise comes through in the background. Personnel is very friendly and drinks go by paid dispenser which charges streetprices! Rooms are small as is the bathroom but it is very clean and they support a method for environmentaly friendly cleaning and changing. Absolutly fully worth it's price of €82 per night. It is 150 meters from Shibuya Station.

I went to tokyo with my fiancee for a week stay in shibuya, this hotel is in a superb position close to shibuya station that will lead you to JR lines and metro lines. The stay in the hotel was excellent, the room was bigger than I expected I ordered a semi double, the room was clean, internet was available, TV working, Bathroom reasonable size, air conditioning working, what more can you ask for?The great thing about the location is it is next to a convenience store which means I could buy food from there and take it up to my room and place it in my fridge without any hassle what so ever.What I also liked was the fact that not once did I get pressured to eat inside the hotel restaurant, I tried breakfast there once but wasn't really a fan of the food and instead went out to eat. You should really check out the little hidden restaurants on the same street, the food in there is great.The hotel staff were polite and friendly and some even had basic english and would help you if they can.I will be going back next year and will be staying here again.

The first thing we noticed was carpet stains everywhere - hallways, and in the room there was a big red splotch next to the bed that looked like a crime scene. In a country like Japan you just don't normally see that sort of grubbiness - we stayed in the Tokyu Inn in Kyoto and the rooms were immaculate. The room was a double and it was absolutely tiny - the double bed was pushed right up next to the wall so only one person could get out from the side. At night there was an awful smell that came through the air conditioning so we had to turn it off altogether. For the price we paid (we booked late so it was about $280 a double) I certainly would not recommend this hotel to anyone, other than for being in the heart of Shibuya which is a fabulous location.

The location, a short stroll from Shibuya station and the crossing, is perfect for visiting Shibuya. Our room was tiny, dark and very orange, but reasonably clean and ok for us to sleep in. I think we chose a standard double room and peeked through the doors to what I guess are the slightly more expensive twin rooms, they seemed decidedly larger and more comfortable and for a couple travelling I would suggest one of those. The hotel as a whole gave a quite run-down impression, but is also not very expensive. I got a little claustrophobic due to the low ceiling, when I first stepped out of the elevator I felt like I was in the cheaper cabin part of a large ferry. We did not try the restaurant at the entrance so cannot comment on that. Shibuya station holds bakeries and other sources for breakfast and there's a starbucks down by the crossing if you haven't dechiffered or learned to like the Tokyo/Japanese morning food.

Stayed 3 nights in mid April 2011, was really pleased with my choice. A semi-double room for one person had everything I needed, even a view of the bustling street 11 floors below and the Karoke rooms opposite ... hilarious!! Asked for and got a non smoking room, clean and quiet with a great night's sleep.Reception staff very helpful, I managed to be understood with my very limited Japanese language and they happily gave me a late checkout (12 midday). Bag storage if you arrive before stated check in time.Rooms are small as is usual in Japan and I could move around comfortably, but let's face it, I was only there to sleep! Bathroom compact and spotless, water hot and good pressure in the shower. Towels changed daily unless you advise otherwise via a card on the door. Small empty refrigerator perfect for money saving purchases at the convenience store down the street and cold drinks. Hot water machine, tea and coffee supplied.The location places you right in the middle of the local action .. day and night! Good access ( 5 mins walk to Shibuya station) to transport to other parts of Tokyo via rail and bus and many attractions in comfortable walking distance. As a solo female traveller I felt comfortable and safe in this hotel and this area of Tokyo.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Tokyo, mainly because of location. My wife and I stayed here 5 nights. It's in a great location essentially in the heart of Shibuya 5 min walk from the 5 ways crossing (and 2 mins if not peak hour pedestrian time) and next to a BIC camera (handy for some). Great night time sights and walking distance to Harajuku up the road. Close the the metro and JR station too.The rooms are pretty small. Typical Japanese style but one of the smallest rooms we stayed in. It was manageable, but you had to put things away and keep it clean. Bed was not great but acceptable. Room was clean. Nothing flash though. Pretty good price vs other options in the area. Staff spoke a bit of english, not much, but enough. they were friendly too. Its al about location and having Shibuya at your door. If you can afford or want biggger rooms there may be better options though?

My stay at the Tokyu Inn was all too short,being only 3 nights.There is so much to see in this lovely place and i had not enough time to see it all.Haridguku St being about a 20 minute walk and historical shinto temples along the way to visit.The rooms were extremely clean and very comfortable,with the provision of clean cotton kimonos for us to wear.Bathroom facilities were fantastic with hand soap,shampoo,conditioner..etc..all provided in pump style containers.Everything from shaving equipment to body sponges were also provided.I feel the only drawback to this lovely hotel was the lack of English spoken by the staff on duty at the time of our stay.After much gesticulating and arm waving,did we get them to understand us.i tried to make a booking for dinner in the on-site restaurent,but to no avail as the restaurent staff could not understand what i was saying.We finally found a lovely italian restaurent just up the road from the hotel.The train line is very close to the hotel and periodically you feel the rumbling of the trains going by.But this was only a small drawback and i would not let it stop me from staying there again..it was a lovely time.

This hotel is 3 minutes from the station, and in the very heart of Shibuya. The staff were helpful and the rooms were spotlessly clean, although on the small side, but that is typically Japan. The bed was nice, I slept very well. Cable internet worked just fine, a bit slow during evenings. There is a hot water kettle along with tea and instant coffee, and also a fridge. I used the laundry service and have nothing to complain about: Leave your clothes before 10am and you'll receive them at 8pm the same day. When I stayed at this hotel it was very hot in Tokyo. There are great blinds in front of the windows to keep the heat out and the air con worked perfectly.The bathroom contains the usual: Toothbrush/paste, shower cream and shampoo/conditioner, bath sponge, shower cap, razor+gel, The bath room is small but well working for its size.There is a restaurant that serves breakfast and other food during the day. The breakfast buffet is 1500 yen. However, you can find good breakfasts for less than 500 yen a couple of minutes away from the hotel. There are many nice eateries around, so you wont go hungry!I went to a conference at Tokyo University, the Komaba campus along the Keio Inokashira line. It took me only 15 minutes to get from my room, to the station, on the train and to the actual conference site at the campus. Very convenient.There are 2 computers with a writer next to the front desk. You can use them for 100 yen/10 minutes. Printing out documents is for free. However, they did not use the Microsoft Office, but OpenOffice, which made some of my prints look funny. All in all, I can really recommend this hotel. I have to admit that I found it a bit expensive given the small room. But apart from that, the hotel was a nice stay.

Quite close to Shibuya station, just around the corner in the direction of Harajuku, inside the Yamanote loop.Room was reasonable, though small like any Tokyo hotel room. The air conditioning was slightly feeble. There was some device in the room that looked like another air conditioner, but it was free-standing so I think it was an ionizer.The front desk gave us a cable for free Internet.The fridge was empty so you could store your own stuff, a nice touch.
This location is excellant! It is around the corner from the buisiest shopping district in Tokyo. The hotel is clean, basic, and has nice beds. Perfect, no frills.

but she stayed in single room.....I want to find out has anyone stayed in a Semi-Double room ?Does the bed sleep 2 adults ?If anyone has stayed at this hotel and used a "Semi-Double" room can they please give me some feedback....Is it ok ?Thanks

The hotel is a five minute stroll from the Shibuya station that will take you anywhere. My room was small but immaculate and well appointed with many goodies, such as a blow dryer, small fridge and tea kettle. The restaurant buffet was fantastic, though not cheap at 1500 yen. I confess to eating there every morning as the food was so healthy and fresh, and the environment, smokeless. Other than the Starbucks ( 5 minutes away), all the cafes and coffee shops are dense with smoke. On a roof top accross the street from the hotel is a large ( ten metre high) bowling pin! I don't know what it represents, but it was a perfect landmark, and made it easy to find my way back to the hotel! As I mentioned, the hotel did not include breakfast, and it cost 100 yen for 10 minutes of internet time on the computers in the lobby. All and all though- for the fabulous location and the level of comfort for the price- it was exactly what I wanted.

This hotel is very good choice if you want to be in Shibuya centre area. The hotel is only about 5 mins away from it's sister hotel, Shibuya Excel Hotel, which is one of the two stops for the airport limousine. It's right in the city centre, where you have many shopping centres such as the Shibuya 109, Parco etc.The rooms, as expected, is quite small but still relatively comfortable. The room comes with free internet and a small bar fridge, which is empty but you can easily get some canned drinks from 5th floor of the hotel or the few convenience stores, that's like 2 minds walk away.

I paid approx $130/night on hotels.com, and based on what that buys in New York City (and the reviews here) I thought I'd get a room similar to a Raddison or Hampton Inn in the states. This place looks like one step above an hourly road motel in New Jersey. While the lobby looks great, The rooms look like they have been seen some heavy volume for a high number of years. As a 1st time visitor to Japan, I expected a level of cleanliness comparable to an operating room, but I noticed (possibly biological) stains on the carpet, bed, and chair. Cigarette burn on the plastic sink of my non-smoking room was one thing that stuck in my mind. Bottom line: if you have the money, go for the Excel where the airport limo bus takes you otherwise don't get your hopes up on the Shibuya Tokyu Inn.

My husband and I stayed in a twin bedroom with our 3-month-old baby for 3 nights. Apparently, rooms with two twin beds are larger than rooms with a double bed. We heard about the small size of hotel rooms in Tokyo and opted to bring our own little baby bed that's about the size of a drawer. It fit neatly under the bench seat in the room while still giving us a little bit of walking space.Make sure you do not exit out of the South exit of the JR Station, as we did, making the walk a little longer than we expected. Head north and it will be a short trek. Pack lightly! We brought two small suitcases instead of one huge one and it was a good choice since we did have to walk a while! There is a coin-operated washer and dryer on the 5th floor, which we used since we only brought clothes enough for 4 days. Our last morning there we washed our clothes before heading off to Kyoto. We asked for a 12:00 checkout time, which is at no extra cost. The dryer doesn't work well so we ended up hanging our clothes up to dry at our next hotel in Kyoto. The washer got the job done and we had clean clothes for the rest of our trip!Loved the location as there are so many stores and restaurants within minutes of walking distance! The night life is really happening!We also opted to not bring a stroller for the baby and it was good for Tokyo since you have to get around on so many trains. Going up and down the stairs to the train stations with a stroller would have been no fun at all.The front desk was very helpful and they speak a little English. Some of the staff members know more English than others. We did not try the restaurant, but went out to explore the town. To save a little bit, we bought rolls and yogurt from the nearby convenience store for our breakfasts. The post office is just around the corner. On the floor above the post office, you can exchange money.It also provides a light robe for you to wear to bed or before bed. In Kyoto, we stayed in Hotel Monterey Kyoto and pajamas are provided. Seems that you do not need to pack your own pajamas when staying in Japan's accomodations.
bitit expensive but everuthing was first class. The eoom was beautiful and so were the grounds. Easy access to the train. The meals were excellent also.

Make sure you reserve the non smoking rooms. The rooms are very old and the bathroom was smelly and falling apart. I've stayed in better 0 star highway motor inns. The only thing it has going for it is the location. We were out every night so we just need a place to crash so we endured it for 5 nights. Its only a short cab ride to Ropongi and easy access to the station. The restaurant was average and they only had vending machines on 1 floor. Stay at the Excell around the corner , we visited there and it was fantastic.Other than that Tokyo was amazing , great shopping and great people.

I went there with my friends only for 3 days 2 night but I was really satisfied. My first impression was about the receptionist. Because the receptionist and the lobby is on bottom floor just like basement. And they very nice. I got there on nine o'clock in the morning and my check in time is about 1-2 pm (I forgot the exact time) so we put our luggage first and go around. After we came back.. they refuse tips. In japan, is one of the country that tips is not exist... haha...After i check in to my room.. the room look small if you compare to European Hotel. But it is nice and very clean. I can see other buildings from my window.The one that i like is when i get up in the morning and took a breakfast. There are a menu that I like very much. It is "NASI GORENG".... yup.... It is my origin's food. Nasi Goreng is from Indonesia and I don't have a problem with this kind of food..The more interesting ones is This Hotel is very near to Youth District. Like shinjuku, harajuku etc. Very near to Bus to Airport from Shibuya Excell Hotel and it only takes about 1300 yen (on 2006).One thing that comes up in my mind....I really want to go to JAPAN again.... :)
Awesome location. Very helpful staff. Small room, but standard for Tokyo. Awesome Awesome Location!

After having stayed at various hotels around Japan and Tokyo this was by far the most spacious and most centrally located hotel of our trip. If you like being close to the "action" and surrounding nightlife then this hotel is for you. It is a short walk to the main shopping/entertainment area and subway station.The staff are very helpful, most speak English, even if only a little the staff will go very far to try and assist with your request. The reception desk gave us directions and a timetable of trains when we departed for the Narita express train. The hotel was spacious compared to some of the other hotels i had stayed in in tokyo and was very clean. The only downfall is that you can hear some things through the thin walls, so if someone accidentally hits the wall it has a bit of an echo, but otherwise there were no issues. The cost was relatively expensive when compared to Australian standards, but we had booked through an agent so this may have contributed to the cost. None-the-less the convenience of the location is a great attraction. If you book direct to the hotel or online it may be cheaper? When i go back to Tokyo I will most definitely stay at this hotel again.

My husband and I stayed here for 10 nights in November. We found it great as we were not far from Shibuya station. Although a very busy station it was easy to find our way around. The hotel room itself was a bit small, but we managed fine as we were only there to sleep. The staff can understand english and can speak it to a certain degree. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast a most mornings, as we found it to be quite cheap @ 1500yen. We found a nice Italian restaurant to the left of the enterance when you walk out of the hotel, this was very nice, cheap with a english menu, it was small so dont miss it. The hotel was not far from Roppongi, Harajuku, Ebisu etc. We caught the train to most places as was very easy. The yamonote line will take you around in one full circle and it will take you to most of the attractions in Tokyo.

We were in Japan on a business trip and we wanted to spend our last night in the Shibuya area. This hotel is convenient to the Shibuya train station. You can easily walk to the hotel with your luggage. The room was a typical Tokyo hotel room, very small. It was clean and the internet worked great. The room included breakfast which was quite good. The room rate was also quite reasonable for a Tokyo hotel. The best part is the location of the hotel because it is in the heart of Shibuya area with restaurants, shops, clubs and a lot of young people. We travel to Japan often on business and if we need to stay in Shibuya again, we would stay at this hotel.

This Hotel is located a couple of 200 meters from Center Gai and 100 meters fra Haitcko crossing where you also find Shibuya station. Shibuya is a very Lively neigbourhood with many shops, bars and fine dining.It's a 15 minutes walk to Yoyogi park and Harajuko.I think you get more value for money if you for instance stay in Akasaka (3 stops from Shibuya on the Ginza line) where it's a bit more quiet than Shibuya. But if you want to stay where the fun is stay in Shibuya.The hotel is average. Nice little building and reception. The rooms are very small compared to hotelrooms in US, but i think this is normal for Tokyo. Very small bathroom. The recepionist spoke a little english just enough to get the information we needed. The rooms are a little worn down, and the atmosphere of the room was not nice. But the best part of this hotel is the loaction.We also stayed at Tobu Hotel in Shibuya and that was better value for money. The hotels in Shibuya are quite pricey compared to other parts of Tokyo. Next time we will probably stay in Cerulan Tower (300 meter from Shibuya station) or Excel City (above the Shibuya station).

I love this hotel. It was easy to find and in an excellent area. It's one block from Shibuya Station. The rooms aren't huge, but were very clean. This is not a luxury hotel, but for the value, I really wouldn't stay anywhere else. It's in the heart of Shibuya and steps away from excellent shopping, bars and restaurants. Everything is literally right outside the hotel. The staff don't speak great english, but they were functional and very friendly. I loved tokyo and would stay here again.

I stayed here for 6 nights during a business trip to Tokyo. Very close to Shibuya station, making it easy to catch the subway/taxis for appointments. You can also take the Narita Express to/from Narita Airport (direct in the mornings and evenings). The hotel room was very small but that's normal in Japan. It had free and fast internet access. The breakfast - Western-style and Japanese - varied from day to day and was better than I have had in many, much grander Tokyo hotels. All round, this was very good value.

For Shibuya the location is perfect. Half a block from the JR a block from Shibuya Crossing, near shopping, bars and restaurants. Yet, as other reviewers have mentioned the rooms are quiet - no street noise. In addition to a great location the rooms are comfortable and clean. My non smoking room request was granted and the whole floor appeared to be smoke free. Each room has free high speed (wired) internet and pretty slick tv with regular channels as well as pay per view. The bed was comfortable and the kimono and memory-foam pillow were nice touches.I would definitely stay here again. For Tokyo I think this is pretty good value for your money.

I stayed at Shibuya Tokyo Inn based on the reccommendations of the reviews and I couldn't have chosen a better hotel.The staff at the check in counter were friendly and, even though their english wasn't top notch, they were more than willing to provide advice and assistance whenever we needed. Loved the classy lobby and the luggage hold service which allowed us to store our luggage in their facilities for free before our 3pm check in to our room.The rooms were comfortable and cosy with spotless linen and the slippers and kimono provided proved of use after a long day exploring the city on our feet!However, I wouldn't reccommend this hotel if you were really tall though- the bathrooms were tiny and were the size of those on cruise ships. That said, it was clean and neat so we didn't mind.The location is only a 3 minutes walk from Shibuya JR station and surrounded by heaps of shops and eateries.Overall it was a pleasant stay and well worth the money. Would highly reccomend!

we were really happy with this hotel, the room and its location. after being in paris and london staying in tiny hotels for the same price we paid for this room, we were very happy.the bed was so comfortable, the room very clean with all modern conveniences you could ask for (hairdyer, cleaning products, kimono, mini bar, trouser press etc). the room was very big, with a bed and a table and chairs. we had a great view over the famous crossing which was priceless really. the decor in the hotel was classy without being tacky and flashy.the location is right in the thick of shibuya, but noise was no problem. i would highly recommend this hotel and its location for a look at the trendy, teenager side of Tokyo.

We intentionally choose to stay in Shibuya because of the young & trendy culture here. Also want a hotel that is next to the JR station & the ‘crossing’ - the area's major action spot. Really happy to have chosen Shibuya Tokyo Inn. Fits all criteria & our budget. Just 3 min walk to the hotel from the JR East exit. When back facing the station exit (ie. front facing main road ‘meji-dori’ & bus stop), turn left & continue along the main road to see the hotel sign. The front desk staffs speak good english. Check in only at 3pm even when we specified early arrival & our friends were given smoking rooms even when non-smoking rooms were reserved. Did get them changed easily when request again. The Double Room is nicely designed, slightly more spacious than usual Tokyo tourist class hotel, feels fresh with clean & quality bed sheets, pillows, carpet & a flat screen TV. The double-size bed is slightly smaller than queen-size. Very quiet room with good air-con (heard that’s available in summer only). Only down side is that there's no view except the back of another building. Enjoyed returning to our room every night or every time we dropped our bags. As for the western/japanese buffet breakfast (included), each dish r well prepared & delicious. Good selections but they r the same for the 3 days we stayed there.Many local eateries, happening restaurants (including the famous 'Lockup' jail-like restaurant), shops & dept stores to attack in the area. Again, when facing the main road ‘meji-dori’ at the hotel entrance, turn left, continue along the main road & u'll reach Harajuku in 15min. A pleasant walk. On the way to Harajuku, across the road, u'll see the 2 Burberry Blue Label & Black Label Harakuju boutiques just 5 min from the hotel, right after another traffic junction. (PS: Service in the boutiques r better than those in dept stores. They provide proper dust bags & packaging.)From Narita Airport, we took Narita Express to Shinjuku & change train to Shibuya. Despite previous experience, still make mistakes when changing train, probably overwhelmed by the peak hr crowds. There r direct Narita Express to Shibuya, but only certain schedules in the evening. If arrive early, suggest to take the Airport Limo Bus (3000yen) to Shibuya Excel Tokyo Hotel instead, to avoid the hassle of changing trains & platforms. We took Airport Limo Bus back to Narita Airport from Excel Hotel (book seats at the Tokyo Inn 1-day inadvance). Only 5 min walk betw 2 hotels, or pay about 800yen for a taxi if there r many luggages. Excel Hotel accepts luggage deposit at 500yen/pc. Overall, excellent location, comfortable & clean room, good price! Perfect if the hotel could provide luggage transfer service to/from Excel hotel on behalf of the guest.
